Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. 
 
 
 
 Pricing Specialist 
 
 
 
 Role Description 
 
 
   The Pricing Specialist is a key resource in providing pricing solutions to DeLaval’s customers across the globe. The Pricing Specialist works with setting global reference prices for products and services, creating analytical reports, defining price logic and price structure for a given assortment together with product management & development, as well as supporting markets in their operational pricing work, such as pricing revisions, running pricing related activities/projects, but also providing general pricing trainings. It is a cross-functional role where collaboration with key stakeholders from different departments and seniority levels is required.
   
 
 
 Key Responsibilities and deliverables 
 
 
 Plan, support and execute the price revisions for selected markets. 
 Support markets with pricing and pricing software related questions. 
 Set and revise global reference prices, develop price structures, and price logics for new and existing products and solutions in collaboration with product management. 
 Communicate and support with implementation of price changes based on price analysis. 
 Lead pricing-related activities/projects including establishing timelines, creating reports based on analytics, defining deliverables, drafting communications and hold presentations. 
 Assist R&D efforts with pricing direction. 
 
 
 
 
 Your qualifications and skills 
 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in statistics, math, engineering, economics or related analytical discipline 
 Relevant work experience within the fields of financial management, controlling, commercial operations or business analysis. 
 Work experience with pricing, including defining pricing concepts and structures will represent a strong merit. 
 Understanding the impact of pricing on profit margins. 
 Analytical and exceptional attention to detail. 
 Practical experience analyzing data, creating reports and ability to work with large volumes of data. 
 Proficiency with analytical and presentation tools such as MS Excel and/or PowerBI, SAP BW and PowerPoint. Knowledge in Access, Excel PowerPivot, SQL and VBA is considered a merit. 
 Self-starter and team player with the ability to work effectively under deadlines and deliverables with limited supervision. 
 Structured with the ability to manage multiple activities/projects concurrently. 
 Effective verbal and written communication skills, including presenting complex concepts in straight-forward ways. 
 Fluent in English (written and spoken), Swedish is an advantage. 
 
 
 
 
 Location  The role is based at our Corporate HQ in Tumba, Sweden. There isthe possibility to partly work remotely in agreement with the manager.
   
 
 Last day to apply is 2024-10-06.  Don’t wait with your application, interviews will be held ongoing so the position may be filled before the final date.
   
 
 
 DeLaval is a worldwide leader in milking equipment and solutions for dairy farmers. With 4500 employees globally we are operating in more than 100 markets, providing worldwide solutions in the Capital Goods and Aftermarket area while taking care of millions of cows per day. We arrange for innovation and expand into new segments while our vision of sustainable food production always ranks first. DeLaval is a company of the Tetra Laval Group. 
 
 
 See more at www.corporate.delaval.com

  As the  QC   Analyst  you are a technical expert charged with performing and supporting the planning of ongoing lab activities to deliver both the project and your own objectives. You plan and ensure the delivery of your work in a timely manner, as defined by the QC Manager. 
  Main responsibilities 
 
 Perform all lab functions in compliance with cGMP 
 Follow written procedures and execute QC testing for the following release tests: Flow Cytometry, ELISA, qPCR, Appearance 
 Provide lab support, including reagent preparation, instrument and facility cleaning and maintenance, order stock and management of laboratory supplies 
 Support Supply Chain, QC and QA in receipt and release of starting and raw materials and consumables according to written specifications 
 Identify and report deviations and test failures 
 Manage incoming samples for release and stability testing 
 Develop / revise current/new SOPs and other GMP documentation 
 Ensure training is current for all job functions performed 
 
 You will also be involved in Technology Transfer (into Procella, out to collaborators or internally with the Analytical Development team) depending on the prevailing project goals of the company and as defined by the line manager. 
 Required qualification and competence 
 Practical experience: 
 
 Demonstrable experience with culturing primary cells or cell lines. 
 Knowledge and understanding of relevant analytical methods such as flow cytometry, qPCR, or ELISA and follow written procedures with close attention to detail. 
 Working knowledge of the GxP laboratory environment, and equipment associated with testing of biopharmaceutical products. 
 Fluent in written and spoken English. 
 Proficient in use of MS Office tools (Word, Powerpoint, Excel, Outlook). 
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal. 
 
 Education: 
 
 BSc and/or MSc in a relevant subject area with 2+ years’ relevant work experience. 
 
 Other meriting experience/competence: 
 
 Prior experience in cell and gene therapy product development in an industry setting. 
 
 
 Prior experience working with pluripotent stem cells. 
 
 
 Prior experience working under a quality system. 
 
 
 Project and people management 
 
 
 Experience with pluripotent stem cell biology and differentiation 
 
 
 Knowledge and understanding of bioreactors, bioprocessing equipment, cell sorting. 
 
 
 Knowledge of ICH Guidelines and Eudralex Volume 4 ATMP Guidelines 
 
 
 Quality by Design methodology, and Design of Experiments 
 
 
 Experience with working under GMP 
 Membership of a professional scientific body

About us  In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Instabox and Budbee - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the customer at heart. 
 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans to stop anytime soon. As we continue to expand our product offering to new merchants and geographic regions, our logistical network and operations are getting increasingly complex. 
  About the role 
 Our dedicated business control & analytics team works tirelessly with supporting our operational and commercial team with insightful analysis. We guide the Swedish management team with everything from short term operational changes to long-term strategic goals, and we need a keen mind like yours to join our ranks. 
 As an Analyst in our team, your mission will be to understand, analyze, and resolve complex business challenges. By working hand-in-hand with various stakeholders, you'll tap into commercial, operational, tech & product departments, among others. 
 We value your expertise and encourage you to carve your unique path. Our goal is to empower you to find the right resources, dive deep into the data, and present your insightful findings. Your analyses will shape our strategic decisions, driving quality and speed in our logistics operations. 
  Key responsibilities 
 The main responsibility for this role is to help and support our operational and commercial team with insightful analysis. 
 
 Support commercial with analysis regards to price negotiations and new offers 
 Guide swedish management team through data driven analysis 
 Set up and track key operational KPI:s 
 Ad-hoc analysis 
 Operational analysis regarding efficiency such as scheduling. 
 
  About you 
 We're searching for an enthusiastic, curious mind who's not afraid to take on unsolved challenges and abstract concepts. Your toolbox should include: 
 
 A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field. 
 Willingness to learn and develop yourself. 
 Familiarity in tools and programming languages such as SQL/R/Tableau or a big eagerness to learn 
 An innate tendency to question and challenge existing structures. 
 Adaptability and resilience in an environment where priorities can shift. 
 An interest in consumer behavior and operational processes. 
 Appreciation for good visual design and an understanding of data visualization techniques. 
 
 
  If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you! 
  What we offer  We can promise you that you will be challenged, that you will develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects that impact Instabee's strategic objectives, in a company which is poised to grow significantly in the years to come. 
 
  This recruitment process consists of personality tests via Alva Labs and background checks as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes in Sweden.

Går du liksom vi igång på digitala kundupplevelser och hur ny teknik kan omsättas för att nå affärsmål och skapa affärsvärde? Du har stort fokus på din kompetensutveckling och vill bygga erfarenhet inom olika branscher. Om du dessutom vill jobba på ett chefslöst företag där du själv sitter i förarsätet och din ambition styr din utveckling kanske du är en av de stjärnor vi ständigt letar efter! 
 Allt fler värdeerbjudande digitaliseras, fler kanaler adderas, den digitala kundrelationen fördjupas och den tekniska utvecklingen driver på i rekordfart. Det är inom detta glödheta område Product & Tech bygger kompetens och förmågor för att hjälpa våra kunder. 
 Vad vi gör 
 Vi leder våra kunder och ger dem genomförandekraft och accelerationsförmåga att snabbt komma ut med nya moderna digitala tjänster och produkter till sina kunder och användare. Vi driver utveckling från idé till vass produkt i många olika roller, där vi som ledare kombinerar stor förståelse för hur teknik möjliggör affärsvärde med ett agilt förhållningssätt och kunskap om nödvändiga delar inom modern systemutvecklingsprocess. 
  Vi växer och söker fler kollegor som vill jobba inom Product & Tech 
 För att möta omgivningens och kundernas förväntningar på snabb digital tjänste- och produktutveckling behöver företag ställa om och skapa moderna produktutvecklingsorganisationer med nya förmågor och kompetenser. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med och hjälpa våra kunder genom hela den digitala produktlivscykeln, och har förmåga och kompetens inom: 
 
 Product Management  – erfarenhet av strategisk och operativ produktledning samt kunskap i hur en effektiv produktorganisation bör sättas upp och fungera. 
 Product Design  – erfarenhet av att identifiera användares verkliga behov samt konkretisera dessa i prototyper, user stories och tilltalande värdeskapande digitala användargränssnitt. 
 Ledning av agil produktutveckling  – kunskap kring hur en effektiv systemutveckling riggas och erfarenhet av att ta ledande roller i sådana tvärfunktionella team, såsom exempelvis Produktägare, Scrum Master, Business Analyst och Test Manager. 
 
 De konsulter som blir framgångsrika på Centigo har oftast tre framträdande styrkor: 
 Entreprenöriell – tar sig an uppgifter som är svåra och utmanande och tycker framför allt om att lösa dem. Tar mer än gärna ett stort eget ansvar och kan tänka sig att driva eget företag, men uppskattar och vill dra fördel av att ingå i det nätverk som Centigo erbjuder. 
 Ambitionsdriven – drivs av egna höga ambitioner och tar ansvar för sin affär såväl som sin professionella och personliga utveckling. 
 Professionell – ser att en hög grad av professionalism är nyckeln till ett framgångsrikt konsultarbete. Är alltid mån om att leverera högsta kvalitet till våra kunder. 
  Din profil 
 
 Du har cirka 3-7 års erfarenhet av att jobba nära digital produktutveckling och har helst arbetat några år som konsult 
 Du har haft ledande roller i agil produktutveckling eller IT-relaterade projekt 
 Du har intresse för teknik och vad den kan bidra med för affären, är nyfiken och allmänt bevandrad kring ny teknik 
 Du utgår alltid från användarnas behov och kanske har erfarenhet av UX/UI 
 Du kan ha erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknik och produktvalsfrågor, och har övergripande förståelse för systemarkitektur och leverantörsutvärdering 
 Du är driven och tar stort eget ansvar, både för din kund och din egen utveckling 
 Relevant akademisk examen, såsom civilingenjör eller Bachelor/Master 
 Du behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.

Position Summary
  
  UNFOLD THE FUTURE  If you aim to grow and curiously explore, you've come to the right place. It's part of our culture. We have countless opportunities available to you, if you are ready to take on responsibility. You have the freedom to chart your own path and explore.    Jumpstart your job journey and become Samsung’s next Future Talent! We are looking for highly motivated fresh graduates to join us in 2025.    This is an opportunity to kick-start your career and develop in various fields. The Talent program aims to establish a robust intake of talented graduates who have the drive and innovative ambition to become Samsung's Future Talents.
  
 
  Role and Responsibilities
  
 
 
  WE OFFER YOU
  
 
 18 exciting & challenging months starting in March 2025 
 Employment into a specific role where you will learn the job and develop skills to become a future specialist or leader in a worldwide top company. 
 Both a dedicated manager and a dedicated mentor who will follow and guide your individual development 
 Training opportunities throughout the journey to expand and deepen your knowledge in various areas 
 Networking opportunities with other graduates and people from all over Samsung 
 Full-time employment with an attractive compensation package 
 Opportunity to work partly remote 
 
 
 
  ROLE AND LOCATION
  
 
 
  We have 4 different graduate roles in the Swedish Marketing Graduate program. Let us know which one you are most interested in!
  
 
 
  Performance Marketing Graduate - Stockholm (Kista) 
 
 
  We are looking for a Performance Marketing Specialist to drive eCommerce results for Samsung.com in Nordic markets. Responsibilities include developing traffic acquisition and optimizing channel mix across Paid Search, Paid Social, Affiliates, and Display/Programmatic, to maximize Samsung.com commercial results with the given media budget. In this role you will work closely together with our Performance Marketing Leads, our media agency and other internal and external stakeholders. You will be supporting our eCommerce campaigns and flagship product launches but also participate in important strategic projects to accelerate media efficiency and sales results.
  
 
 
  Junior Marketing Lead Graduate - Stockholm (Kista) 
 
 
  The overall objective is to increase brand preference and interest in our TV & Sound products, helping Samsung maintain its position as the most innovative electronics brand in the Nordic region. As part of the marketing team, you will focus on digital marketing and play a vital role in demonstrating our product value to consumers through online channels and retailers. Your mission is to turn our marketing strategy into practical actions that attract new customers and strengthen relationships with existing retailers.
  
 
 
  You are driven to maximize the impact of our campaigns, support the team, and ensure that our products are seen by end-consumers through engagement with our retailers and new channels. Your exceptional organizational skills and hands-on approach will help us exceed our sales targets.
  
 
 
  CRM Analyst Graduate – Stockholm (Kista) 
 
 
  As a CRM Analyst graduate at Samsung, you will be responsible for defining and executing analyses within the CRM Team. Your role involves ensuring that analyses are carried out, as well as driving continuous improvement by providing results and insights to the CRM team.
  
 
 
  Working closely with CRM leads and specialists, you will be part of analyzing all aspects of CRM. Your responsibilities will include collecting and evaluating customer data from different sources to spot trends, improving customer segmentation strategies, and assessing the outcomes.
  
 
 
  PR & Communications Graduate – Stockholm (Kista) 
 
 
  In this role, you will support the Samsung Corporate Communications & PR team and lead various PR activities across the Nordics to achieve the brand's long-term and short-term goals. You will build product brand awareness through a continuous and high-quality presence in the media and social media, developing visibility further in the new media landscape.
  
 
 
  As the Junior PR & Communications Officer, your daily work contains of different areas within PR & Communications. You will support in creating and executing strategic projects, lead own tasks, and ensure effective messaging to support product launches, content, campaigns, and events. It’s great if you are interested earned media, communication, images and creative content.
  
 
 
  Skills and Qualifications
  
 
 
  WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  
 
  Communicative team players, who are creative and analytical. With an interest in digital and marketing landscape in the Nordics. Curious, asking and answering questions others don´t, and testing solutions others haven´t thought of trying.
  
 
 You have recently graduated or on your final year of studies towards an MSc or BSc degree or related program ideally in: Business and Management, Marketing, Digital Media, Communication. 
 Valid work permit and fluency in English is a must 
 For PR & Communications, and Marketing Lead Graduate fluency in Swedish is required. For other roles Nordic languages are a plus 
 
 
 
  ABOUT THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS
  
 
  To help us place the right people in the right roles, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, knowledge, and attributes relevant to Samsung will be assessed.
  
 
 
  The recruitment process is ongoing but press play and apply at the latest: 2024-12-06.
  
 
 
  ABOUT SAMSUNG
  
 
  A world-class brand is built on world-class people. That's why we need you. Imagine a tech-bustling and energetic place where the future is already on display - and you are part of the picture. Samsung is a global innovation hub where ideas are born, and technology revolutionizes as we go, right there at the very forefront. To succeed, we need to work together. Because WE are much better than ME. Want to join the crew? Apply to Samsung and make it happen. Just press play.

You understand business needs and can assess the benefits for our customers. You have the ability to interpret these needs into IT solutions within an organization. As a consultant working with our clients, it's essential that you are proactive and a "doer" who ensures that things get done. 
 
 RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
 As a Requirements Analyst, you are adept at gathering detailed business requirements through meetings and interviews with stakeholders. You have a knack for documenting these requirements clearly into specifications, user stories, and use cases. Your ability to analyze and prioritize requirements allows you to assess viability and business impact effectively. Acting as a connection between stakeholders, you ensure clear communication and a shared understanding of requirements. 
 
 You manage changes to requirements throughout the project lifecycle, keeping all parties updated and supporting development and testing teams by clarifying requirements and resolving issues. 
 
 You participate in quality assurance activities to ensure that the final solution meets business needs, and assist in creating user manuals and training materials. Your commitment to continuous improvement drives you to enhance the requirements gathering and analysis process, aligning with industry best practices. 
 
 We highly value personal qualities such as cooperation, initiative, and a strong sense of responsibility. It's also crucial that our consultants maintain a professional and business-oriented approach when interacting with customers. 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS 
 
 We would like you to 
 
 
 Have at least 3 years of experience as a requirements analyst, product owner, scrum master, agile coach or similar role in, for example, retail, banking and insurance or the public sector. 
 Have experience from several industries. 
 Wanting to help the organization work as good as possible in order to develop the best possible products. 
 Is a doer. We know, this is one of the most common clichés to write in job ads, but for our team structure to work, this is extra important. By doer, we mean that you take initiative and are decisive. You don't let the fear of making mistakes stop you. 
 Speak and write Swedish and English fluently. 
 
 
 YOU WILL GET 
 
 An environment where skills development and sharing experiences is important. 
 The opportunity to influence your assignments. 
 
 
 
 Opportunity for individual development in areas outside your profession by engaging in operations internally. 
 Different communities where consultants exchange knowledge and discuss solutions to challenges they face in their consulting role. 
 Offices located in Gothenburg, Malmö and Stockholm. 
 
 
 Most of our assignments are larger IT projects where various testing methodologies are applied. Usually with Agile methodologies but also traditional waterfall-based IT development. 
 
  WE OFFER YOU 
 
 We offer a collaborative and open environment with streamlined decision-making processes and colleagues who share common values of curiosity, creativity, and commitment. Our work culture empowers you to influence and make independent decisions. We provide the necessary tools to create an optimal setting for your personal and professional growth, contributing to the company’s long-term success. We trust in the abilities of our employees and appreciate the value of leveraging each individual's unique strengths. 
 
 
 Manage your own development plan. 
 Market salary. 
 Ability to customize part of your salary according to your own priorities. 
 Flexible working environment. 
 Full-time

Who we are 
 Since our start in 2017 we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the world’s financial health. 
 So far, we’ve helped Swedes, Finns, Norwegians, and Germans save millions by refinancing expensive consumer credits. But we aim higher; more customers to service, new products to launch and new markets to expand into. This means we need more brains and hearts to fuel our growth. That is why we are currently searching for our next colleague to join us as a Business Analyst 
  What you will be doing 
 In this role you will analyse credit performance and become an expert at our business. Credit is the core of Anyfin. It’s how we help customers and make great business decisions. You will work with other analysts in a team that cares about results and creating value together. Some specific areas you will focus on are: 
 
 Credit losses and approval rates across different markets. Optimise between risk and reward to maximise business value. 
 Customer acquisition costs and profitability. Decide what customer segments we should acquire and design pricing strategies that lead to the best outcomes. 
 Churn and customer satisfaction. Take lead on new strategies and product features that make our service better. 
 
  Who you are 
 We are looking for someone who creates value by solving problems and takes initiative to get things done. To succeed you will need to have the drive to move things forward, strong analytical skills and learn the ins and outs of the business. For this role we believe you have the following: 
 
 A results-oriented mind and you actively take initiative to make things happen 
 Degree in a quantitative field like finance, mathematics or engineering 
 Experience of an analytical role or similar 
 
  What we offer    We offer you the chance to be part of something truly amazing. You will get the chance to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues in the Analytics team and a lot of other disciplines. Furthermore we promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop and given the opportunity to shape and build the future of Anyfin. We pride ourselves with always having a customer first mindset and the way we manage to do that is by having genuinely friendly colleagues who create the best possible work environment. 
 Then there is the compensation package, centrally located cozy office, extra time off on your birthday and a bunch of other benefits as well. But we will get to all that in due time. For now begin your journey with us by clicking "Apply" below. 
  We work from the office 4 days a week. Simply because we believe innovation and collaboration happen when we meet in person. 
  Unfortunately we will not be offering relocation support for this position. 
 We cannot wait to meet you! 
 
 About Anyfin 
  Who are we? 
 Anyfin is an innovative startup with a mission to help people to become their best financial self. We know that money can be tricky for many, therefore we wanted to create an easier way of understanding and improving your finances. 
  What do we do? 
 Anyfin is a smart financial-app where you get a great overview of your spendings, income, subscriptions and much more. We also provide a service that helps lowering the cost of consumer loans and credits by reducing high interests, and removing unnecessary fees. Overall, the app is a great tool to understand your finances better. 
  What about the future? 
 We are constantly growing and by 2024 we will launch even more services. Fun, huh? Come join our journey and work with ambitious people from all over the world. (Our office is based in Stockholm.)

job_title: Digital Strategy Product Data Analyst to H&M Sales (Parental Cover) – Digital Experience & Commercial Unit
job_description:
Company Description 
  **This is an 11 months contract** 
 H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day. 
 We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong. 
 Be yourself & more at H&M.  Job Description 
 
  The Digital Strategy Analytics Team supports the Value Streams and Commercial Teams within the Digital Unit with actionable insights and data-driven strategic options. This role will support our global digital product teams in improving our shoppers’ journeys and growing their analytics prowess by steering data-driven roadmaps and commercial initiatives. The role interacts with a vast number of stakeholders (regional teams, central BI teams, commercial leaders, expansion teams, product teams) to coordinate the totality of conversations and competencies around our digital business performance.  Some of your main responsibilities & tasks will include: 
 Coordinate analytical projects across Digital Value Streams (for example, Pay, Receive & Return or Inspire & Discover), leading the process of hypothesis formulation - analysis - conclusion – recommendations 
 With high customer centricity, empower stakeholders to improve the customer experience through expert analysis of behavioral, commercial and product performance data 
 Help steer product roadmaps by supporting Product Managers and Value Stream Managers to prioritize resource allocation and product / value stream backlogs 
 Build and take ownership of business cases owned by the value streams, bringing together commercial, digital, user behavior understanding 
 Help commercial stakeholders understand the performance of products and features owned by your value stream peers 
 Work with multiple advanced analytics tools to analyze, execute and follow up initiatives from idea to industrialization 
 Be the driver for data driven decision making by enabling data visibility and educating the different stakeholders 
 Convert different forms of data into common language in order to guide commercial and regional teams 
 Use SQL, Google BigQuery, Google Looker, PowerBI and other analytical tools to dive deep into the data lake 
 Participate in the wider analytics community, both within CX&S and the wider H&M group 
    Qualifications 
  Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a sales-minded, social, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability with an eye for change and improvement opportunities. 
 
 3+ years of experience from product or business analysis, customer or commercial analytics, management consulting 
 Very strong experience with SQL 
 Previous experience with cloud analytics environments such as Databricks or GCP 
 Previous experience within ecommerce, retail, fashion or tech product driven companies 
 Academic degree within Business Administration, Economics, Engineering (or similar) 
 Experience in working with data visualization tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, etc 
 Demonstrated ability to synthesize large amounts of data into clear insights 
 Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across different competences (Commercial Leads, eCommerce Managers, Product Managers, Developers, Designers, Data Engineers, etc.) 
 Be comfortable with working within a large matrix organization 
 Strong communication skills and an ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders 
 Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills 
 Fluent in English (written and spoken) 
    Additional Information 
  H&M Group is a value-driven company that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. 
 Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. 
 The role is based in Stockholm. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English. We will review and interview applicants continuously. 
  Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. 
 We look forward to receiving your application! 
  H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.

Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience,  digital yet personal . 
 Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 170 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products. 
  Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey! 
  About our tech stack: 
 
 FiveTran 
 Snowflake 
 DBT 
 ThoughtSpot 
 AWS (Lambda, S3, ECR) 
 
  About the role 
  We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our dynamic and cross-functional team. As a Data Analyst at Northmill, you will collaborate closely with Data Engineers, fellow Data Analysts, and Data Scientists to leverage data-driven insights that will drive our business forward. Your primary focus will be on data driven insights across various areas of the bank. 
 In this multifaceted role, you will get the opportunity to dig into a wide variety of business areas within the Bank. You will work closely with stakeholders in other departments such as product development, marketing, customer center and credit underwriting. 
 Your contributions will play a vital role in shaping the future of our fintech bank, and your work will have a direct impact on our success in the competitive financial industry. 
  Responsibilities 
 
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into analytical solutions. 
 Create actionable insights and data visualizations that drive decision-making processes across the bank. 
 Work closely with fellow analysts to shape data insights as well as Data Engineers to build data models in new areas. 
 
  Your background 
 The ideal candidate has excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities, effective communication skills, and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes. 
 
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field 
 Minimum 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or similar roles. 
 Proficiency in SQL/Snowflake for data querying and manipulation. 
 Programming skills in Python and/or R. 
 Fluency in Swedish and English 
 
  Fun Facts: 
 
 Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city. 
 Event - highly appreciated “Northchill” every month. 
 Health - 5000 kr health care allowance 
 Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday. 
 Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office. 
 Stockholm's most beautiful office space, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace. 
 
  Apply today and be a part of Northmill!

What you will do  You will be joining the Business Analytics team within Funnel’s established Revenue Operations function. As a Data Analyst, you will use data to; find and answer difficult business questions, identify problems & opportunities, make recommendations, and find solutions. You will work closely with our Revenue Operations team and directly with our go-to-market teams to share your findings, build business context, and develop recommendations. Areas of interest would include sales pipeline data, customer acquisition data, client product usage data, and many more. 
 You will not just crunch numbers but understand the story they tell about our business. Your insights will drive strategic decisions and influence the way we operate. 
  Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: 
 
 Analyze, interpret, and predict data to uncover trends and insights that impact revenue and customer behavior. 
 Create dashboards and reports to help us understand e.g. our marketing, sales and customers. 
 Find and share insights to drive improvements, making our processes smoother and more effective. 
 Collaborate with other data and analytics teams at Funnel to solve larger organizational problems. 
 You'll be a bridge between data and decisions, working closely with departments across the company to translate numbers into action. 
 
 
  Some examples of past and current deliverables: 
 
 Create a customer health scoring model to predict & prevent customer churn. 
 Create a lead scoring model to assess lead quality and predict conversion rates. 
 Build a framework to connect sales team actions to outcomes, for example, how calls, meetings, etc. impact conversion rates and business results like revenue. 
 
 
  Who you are  We are looking for a data analyst who either has or would like to build a deep understanding of go-to-market teams within a fast-growing SaaS company. 
 Furthermore, we are looking for these attributes: 
 
 You have a drive and an ambition to contribute, as well as a concern for the needs of customers and colleagues. 
 An eagerness to learn and improve and you actively seek new ideas and learning opportunities. 
 The ability to use your business understanding to enrich your analytical work, ensuring that your work contributes to business strategy. 
 Adaptable and open-minded. Working with cross-functional teams means the context of our analyses must change to fit the appropriate context. 
 Great communication skills. Open to disagreeing and not being “right”. You have the confidence to share your opinions and thoughts openly. 
 
 
  Experiences & skills: 
 
 Demonstrable expertise with tools or scripting language for data analytics e.g. Python or R. In other words: more than spreadsheets! 
 Expertise in SQL for analytic queries and reporting 
 Experience with specific data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc. 
 Fluent in written and spoken English 
 
 
  It is beneficial if you also have: 
 
 Experience working with go-to-market team data (for example CRM, SaaS, and sales cycle data) 
 Experience with more advanced analytics (such as website lead cohort analysis, regression analysis, predictive analytics, or statistical modeling) 
 
 
 Experience in working in analytics or a related field 
 
  Who we are 
 
 Take a look at our Funnel benefits! 
 
  Funnel is a Swedish-founded company with headquarters in Stockholm. Our SaaS product is designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, and Sydney offices. 
 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data. 
  Other information  
 This role is located in Stockholm, at our centrally located office at Klarabergsgatan 29 with three floors. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work the majority of the week from our office. 
 We are not able to sponsor relocation and therefore we will take into consideration only applicants who are located in Stockholm, and: 
 
  Hold Swedish citizenship 
 Hold EU/EEA citizenship 
 Have a valid work permit for working in Sweden

Are you analytical, enjoy working with data, and enthusiastic about driving business growth? 
 We are seeking a Performance Marketing Analyst to join Desenio’s Sales & Performance team, focusing on digital marketing across social media and search channels. In this role, you will handle business-critical data, perform analysis, work with our social media calendar and make strategic marketing and resource allocation decisions daily to enhance our profitability and achieve growth objectives. 
 
  WHAT YOU WILL DO 
 
 Data Analysis & Optimization:  Analyze data sets to evaluate marketing channel performance at group, brand, and market levels. Identify trends and insights to optimize ad content, marketing strategy and resource allocation continuously. 
 
 
 Social Media & Search Campaigns:  Evaluate and enhance the performance of social media and search campaigns, ensuring continuous improvement and optimization. 
 
 
 Daily Performance Monitoring:  Monitor performance data daily, providing ongoing evaluation and optimization of all channels. 
 
 
 KPI Management:  Understand and manage marketing budget processes. Onwership for meeting key performance indicators (KPIs) such as CAC, CPC, CoS, Revenue and more. 
 
 
 Financial Management:  Participate in budgeting process for marketing activities and manage daily and monthly spend levels across media channels. 
 
 
 Collaboration:  Work closely across the Desenio marketing team, Commercial Department and vendors to develop and execute social media marketing plan. 
 
 
 Emerging Platforms:  Develop brand presence on emerging social media platforms and new digital channels. 
 
 
 Social media calendar:  Own our paid social media planner and lead marketing projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely delivery of creative assets while maintaining quality and brand consistency. Work closely with creative, product, to ensure marketing strategies and assets align with product offerings, market demands, business objectives and brand identity. 
 
 
  WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR 
 
 Undergraduate degree in marketing, business, mathematics, or economics. 
 
 
 Minimum 2 years of experience in a paid marketing role, a plus if you have experience working in-house 
 
 
 E-commerce paid performance experience is a plus. 
 
 
 Excellent English proficiency, both spoken and written. 
 
 
 Proficiency with Meta Ads Manager and TikTok Ads Manager. 
 
 
 Experience with Google Ads, Google Merchant Center, GA4. Other paid platforms are a plus. 
 
 
 Familiarity with marketing and reporting platforms like Funnel and Looker Studio. 
 
 As a person, you are analytical, structured and a real problem solver. We believe that you have a critical mindset in order to quantify the biggest actual value and priorities. To succeed in this role you have a proactive mindset, good communication skills, a can-do attitude and great attention to details. You will be part of a loyal and kind team who works very closely to the business. 
  WHAT WE OFFER 
 At Desenio you’ll be working together with our young, multicultural team in the company’s beautiful premises at Stockholm’s Södermalm. We believe that together, in the actual meet and interaction we achieve greatness but also that the employee should enjoy flexibility in terms of work place. The company culture is including and meant to support your personal development. You will be part of a dynamic and change driven organization where we all work together with the aim to make affordable art available for everyone. 
 
  PRACTICAL INFORMATION 
  Start date : As soon as possible 
  Extent:  This is a permanent position with an initial probation period of 6 months. 
  Location:  Södermalm, Stockholm. 
  We will start selecting and interviewing right away and the position might be filled before last application date. We don't accept applications through email.

Join Greenely's mission to pioneer Europe's energy transition, where we strive to reduce household energy bills to zero. By optimizing energy consumption and enabling virtual power generation, we're navigating families through the complexities of electricity with our innovative platform. As part of this ambitious journey, we're in search of a Data Analyst to join our Virtual Power Plant team with a passion for data-driven insights and a mastery of Tableau to join our mission-driven team. 
 
  Your daily work includes: 
 
 Utilize Tableau, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel to develop and maintain insightful dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators, and revealing data-driven stories that inform business strategies. 
 Collaborate with teams across the company to identify their data analysis needs, delivering tailored insights that support diverse objectives, from product development to customer engagement. 
 Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data through meticulous quality checks, while also championing the adoption of best practices in data management and analytics. 
 Stay ahead of the curve on the latest analytics trends and technologies, bringing innovative approaches to enhance Greenely's data-driven decision-making processes. 
 
 
  What you'll need to succeed : 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. 
 At least 2+ years of hands-on experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of expertise in Tableau and comprehensive knowledge of Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel. 
 Solid understanding of SQL and familiarity with Python or R. 
 Exceptional analytical, organizational, and communication skills. 
 
  We'll be really impressed if you : 
 
 You're a data wizard, adept at transforming raw data into clear, actionable insights, with a robust analytical toolkit that includes advanced proficiency in Tableau. 
 Expert knowledge of Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel is crucial, as you'll leverage these platforms for comprehensive event tracking and analytics across our digital products. 
 Your technical skill set is rounded out with SQL proficiency and experience with data analysis programming languages such as Python or R. 
 Excellent communication skills define you, enabling you to demystify complex data findings and translate them into strategic insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
 You're known for your problem-solving prowess, keen eye for detail, and the ability to juggle multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. 
 Experience with battery storage systems, solar systems, electricity engineering, or similar fields would be a significant advantage. 
 A genuine interest in the energy sector and a commitment to Greenely's mission to empower households in the energy transition would make you an ideal fit. 
 
 By joining Greenely, you'll be at the heart of a team dedicated to creating a sustainable future, leveraging your analytical skills to make a tangible impact on our mission. Here, your work will not only contribute to optimizing energy consumption but also play a crucial role in driving the energy transition forward. 
 
  What we can offer you  ‍  : 
 
 Flexibility : We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40. 
 Growth : Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization. 
 Influence and Impact : Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making. 
 Innovative Environment : Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere. 
 
 
  We place high emphasis on your interpersonal abilities at Greenely. Greenely's strength is drawn from team members who don't just do their job, but who actively shape the way we work. We seek individuals who naturally take charge, own their responsibilities with pride, and consistently hold themselves accountable. We're searching for someone who can gracefully navigate change, who sees challenges not as obstacles but as puzzles waiting to be solved, and who values the collective success of the team. 
 
  About Greenely  Greenely aims to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. Greenely's integrated mobile application enables households to optimize their energy consumption, reduce their electricity costs, and participate in grid balancing services. By connecting various energy assets in the home, Greenely's platform allows consumers to manage their energy usage efficiently while contributing to the stability of the power system. Greenely's solution addresses the challenges of the modern energy landscape and promotes a more efficient, sustainable, and reliable power system. By providing consumers with savings and new revenue streams, Greenely drives the transition to a cleaner and more resilient energy system.

Stockholm, Sweden
  
 
 
 This is Worldline 
 
 
  Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
  
 
 
 The O pportunity 
 
 
  We are a Sales Strategy & Enablement team supporting the Nordic region and due to one of us going on parental leave, we are looking for a data driven colleague to join our team in Stockholm (or Mölndal). This is a temporary employment starting as soon as possible and ending on 31st of August 2025.
  
 
 
  The Sales Strategy & Enablement team is responsible to set the strategy for what products and offers we need to drive sales and revenues, prevent churn and increase market shares in the Nordics. We coordinate new product launches and cross Nordic initiatives. We also propose acquisitions, partnerships, and new collaborations both internally with the group and externally to reach delivery on our strategic agenda.
  
 
 
  As a Commercial Analyst your responsibility is to support the team and the sales organization with data and analysis. Tactically you will extract relevant data from our data sources such as BI- and CRM systems, analyze, structure and present the data, prepare business cases, etc. You will also participate in projects and coordinate cross Nordic initiatives. Part of your job will be to work with churn prevention and drive related activities. You will work actively together with Sales managers, Marketing and Product Management but also with our global colleagues when we introduce/share products and best practices. In this role you will report to Head of Sales Strategy and Enablement.
  
 
 
  We welcome you to a team of engaged, knowledgeable and dedicated peers that would love to work with you. We are committed to continuous improvements and are always looking for ways to improve quality, reduce costs, build excellent solutions, and grow customer happiness. We would like to welcome a commercial, customer focused and result oriented colleague to our team.
  
 
 
 Day-to-Day Responsibilities  
 
 
 Extract data from various data sources like BI- & CRM systems 
 Analyze and structure data 
 Drive churn prevention activities 
 Coordinate cross Nordic projects 
 Engage cross Business Units (Europe) for knowledge sharing and best practice 
 If not already, become an expert in payments and actively drive leadership in payments 
 
 
 
 
 Who Are We Looking For 
 
 
  People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
  
 
 
 You have full working proficiency in English and another Nordic language 
 A natural talent and a true passion for working with numbers 
 You have excellent skills in Excel 
 Good experience of BI- & CRM systems 
 Bachelor degree in a technical field or Business Administration or equivalent experience 
 You are a great communicator and excellent in presenting complex data in a simple way 
 You prove to be a self-motivated, helpful teammate taking ownership of your own projects and personal development 
 
 
 
 
 Perks & Benefits 
 
 
  At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
  
 
 
 A pension plan 
 Health contribution 
 Health check – Every 2:nd year 
 Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident) 
 Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave 
 Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard 
 Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more. 
 
 
 
 Shape the evolution 
 
 
  We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
  
 
 
 Learn more about life at Worldline at  jobs.worldline.com 
 
 
 
 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

job_title: Business Analyst med intresse för verksamhetsutveckling...
job_description:
Om Prevas Product Information 
  Gemensamt för oss på Prevas är att vi älskar att lösa våra kunders utmaningar med teknikens hjälp. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta på ett spännande och innovativt företag i framkant. 
 På affärsenheten Prevas Product Information i Stockholm är vi en grupp som specialiserat oss på verksamhetsnära rådgivning inom informationshantering och Product Lifecycle Management. Vi är ett litet gäng som alla löser komplexa problem och utmanar våra kunder att förbättra och effektivisera sina organisationer. 
 Vårt arbete bedrivs oftast i projektform och projekten varierar i inriktning och storlek, allt från mindre förstudier på 3-6 månader till större program som varar flera år. Du utgår från vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm men våra industrikunder finns i hela landet och resor kan förekomma om uppdraget kräver det.   
 Trivs du att arbeta i en familjär atmosfär där vägen från idé till handling är kort så är Prevas Product Information något för dig. För oss är gemenskap viktigt och vi är alla delaktiga och bidrar till att utvecklar företaget. 
  Nu behöver vi bli fler och hoppas att du vill bli en i gänget! 
  Rollen 
 Som verksamhetsutvecklande konsult driver du våra kunder framåt i uppdrag som förstudier, framtagning av digital strategi, digitala transformationsprogram och IT implementeringsprojekt. Hos oss kommer du att agera i roller som t.ex. projektledare, programledare eller produktägare. 
 I rollen ingår mycket egen kundkontakt. Detta ställer krav på samarbetsförmåga, verksamhetsförståelse och intresse för problemlösning. Rollen är bred och ger en god möjlighet att arbeta med hela kedjan från initiala dialoger till offert, leverans och förvaltning. Det är viktigt att du vill vara en del i att driva vårt bolag framåt och tycker det är kul att bidra internt. Detta jobb passar dig som är självgående, lösningsorienterad, nyfiken och vill arbeta nära våra kunders processer. 
  Vem är du? 
 Vi söker dig som är affärsinriktad och som drivs av att skapa kundvärde. Du ska ha: 
 
 Utbildning som civilingenjör, gärna med inriktning mot produktutveckling, IT, industri, ekonomi, system eller management 
 Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska 
 Minst 3 års arbetserfarenhet inom relevant verksamhet 
 Arbetserfarenhet från verksamhetsutveckling, som stora implementations- och förändringsprojekt 
 Erfarenhet att skapa och hålla presentationer (verbalt och skrift) 
 Teknisk kompetens inom till exempel PLM, PIM, ERP, CAD, AI eller Graph DB. 
 Vana att arbeta digitalt med Microsoft Office 365 
 
 Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av: 
 
 Digitaliseringsprojekt inom stora organisationer 
 Modularisering och produktpaketering 
 Agil projektmetodik 
 Konsultrollen 
 Arbete med industriell IT, gärna inom produktinformationshantering 
 Erfarenhet som facilitator av “work-shops” och intervjuer i förstudieprojekt 
 
 Som person är du målmedveten, engagerad och har en positiv attityd. I botten ligger ett genuint intresse för att med teknikens hjälp lösa kundernas problem. 
  Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!  
 Du är varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Omed Lachin om du vill veta mer om tjänsten eller bara vill ha en öppen dialog.   omed.lachin@prevas.se, Tel: 076-529 49 92 
 Även om du inte känner dig helt speglad i varje jobbkrav som listas i annonsen uppmuntrar vi dig ändå att kontakta oss och ansöka! Forskning har visat att kvinnor och underrepresenterade grupper ofta bara ansöker när de känner sig 100% kvalificerade. Vi är engagerade i att skapa ett rättvist, inkluderande företag med mångfald och vi uppmuntrar starkt sökande av alla kön, åldrar, etniciteter, kulturer, förmågor, sexuell läggning och livserfarenhet att ansöka. 
 Välkommen att bli en del av vårt dynamiska och kreativa gäng! 
  Om oss 
 Lär dig mer om Prevas Product Information här:  Produktinformation (PLM) (prevas.se) 
  Prevas är ett utvecklingshus där påhittigheten står i centrum. Med hög teknisk kompetens och affärsförståelse hjälper vi kunder inom vitt skilda branscher att dra större nytta av vår tids teknikutveckling. Nytta för människor, planeten och ekonomin. Prevas startade 1985 och är idag 800 medarbetare i Sverige, Danmark och Norge.  
 Prevas är börsnoterade på NASDAQ Stockholm sedan 1998. För mer info om Prevas, besök  www.prevas.se 
  Och du, följ oss gärna på  LinkedIn  och   Instagram.

ABOUT THE ROLE 
 
 
  As our app-focused Engineering Digital Analyst, you will be a key member of the Analytics Engineering team, playing an important role in shaping the behavioral tracking strategy across our entire organization. In this position, you'll be hands-on with Firebase app tracking strategies, providing guidelines for developers, implementing web tracking, managing data pipelines, and working extensively with tools such as BigQuery, Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Firebase, and Google Tag Manager. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure seamless tracking and data collection, enabling Business intelligence to build reports that unlock behavioral insights for stakeholders. 
 This role offers a unique opportunity to work across all brands, domains, and teams within the company, providing valuable insights that directly impact our business. You'll collaborate closely with teams such as Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Product teams, and CRO to understand the systems and data points relevant to each group, guiding developers on best practices for data collection. Additionally, you'll operate in a high-performing live environment where your code can be deployed directly to production, allowing you to see the immediate impact of your work. This position is ideal for someone eager to challenge and improve existing processes, leading the way to a more efficient and impactful data-driven iGaming experience. 
 
  YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR: 
 
 
 Be part of the Analytics Engineering team and work hands-on with app & web implementations, BigQuery, and data pipelines 
 Have the opportunity to work with a global tracking setup of client-side tagging, server-side tagging, GA4 and Firebase 
 Work across all brands, domains, verticals, and teams within the company 
 Implement tracking on apps so the data can be used in BigQuery to analyze behavior to help create a better product 
 Improve app tracking strategies and make sure our setup is scalable and work as it should 
 Find ways to automate manual processes 
 Work in a high-performing live environment, which enables you to deploy and deliver your code straight to production. 
 Challenge and improve existing ways of working and lead the way to a better iGaming experience by delivering insights that bring business values and actions 
 Work with Firebase, Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager (client and server) and BigQuery 
 Guide developers on how they should implement dataLayer pushes in the client for web, and instructions on how to send events in Firebase that way the data can be collected, processed, visualized, and used as valuable insights 
 Work closely with the product to understand the systems and data points applicable to each group 
 Collaborate with cross-company departments to maintain organization-wide data standards. 
 
 
  OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING: 
 
 
  ESSENTIAL SKILLS 
 
 A team player with a passion for the industry 
 3+ years of relevant work experience in Google Tag Manager (server and client) 
 3+ years of relevant work experience in Google Analytics 
 Experience in validating and performing QA to ensure implemented data is of top quality 
 Good knowledge of JavaScript and a good understanding of web technology 
 
  NICE TO HAVES 
 
 Experience with Server Side Google Tag Manager and Firebase 
 Tableau, BigQuery 
 
  WHO WE ARE 
  At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide. 
 
 BENEFITS 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hybrid work policy 
 4 weeks of Workation  ( T&C apply) 
 30 annual vacation days 
 Occupational Pension 
 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually 
 Parental Leave Top-Up 
 Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner 
 1,500 SEK equipment allowance 
 Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts 
 We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights. 
 
 
  JOIN US!   
 
  In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen! 
 
  Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
  
 
 
  **As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please**
  
 
 
  _________________________________________________________________________________________________

Securitas Group 
  Strongly united by the purpose  “We help make your world a safer place” , Securitas successfully integrates technology, people and knowledge to offer protective services to clients all over the world. Securitas offers security services by combining expertise in on-site, mobile and remote guarding with electronic security and experience in fire and safety. The group has 341,000 employees in 44 markets worldwide. 
 
  Securitas IT 
  Securitas vision  is to become the Intelligent Protective Services Partner through being  client centric, data driven, and people focused . Our protective services help make your world a safer place. 
  Securitas IT  creates capabilities and powerful technology needed to fulfill Securitas business strategy to be  client centric, data driven, and people focused.  We transform, build and protect our IT landscape in a cost-efficient a sufficient way. We lead a diverse and inclusive global organization with approx 900 co-workers within IT. 
 
 As a Business Analyst , you interpret business needs and convert them into IT requirements along with supporting processes for implementation in the defined IT services for the business. You will develop and maintain IT services and relevant tools to realize business benefit and service continuity over time. You will guide the business towards use of defined IT services and architecture to promote re-use of existing services and adherence to long term IT architecture and roadmaps. You will work in close cooperation with Product Owners and Project Managers over the entire project delivery lifecycle to ensure solutions are delivered according to business needs and are taken into use after project completion. 
 
  Key Responsibilities: 
 
 Define, interpret, translate, analyse and document business requirements into technical specifications ready for prioritization, commitment and implementation 
 Manage requirement proposals and mediate information from both IT and Business including documentation of flowcharts and processes using relevant 
 Support business in demand and development to realize business value 
 Identify involved business and IT stakeholders to get valid input and validate business needs 
 
 
 Key Deliverables: 
 
 Well defined business and IT requirements ready for implementation 
 Communication between business, IT and cross functional teams 
 Services delivered in alignment with business and enterprise architecture  Spokesperson for the business in development initiatives to realize business benefit and use of new services and solutions
  
 Key Partnerships: 
 
 
 Product Owners, Project Managers, Oracle Solution Architect  – Collaborates on how to achieve deliverables and plan how to action business solutions 
 Business Owner  - Alignment on business processes driving the solutions, support in translating business processes into working IT solutions within the frame of the overall enterprise architecture 
 
 
  Key Personal Skills: 
 
 Very good knowledge in  Oracle Fusion Cloud SCM  modules Procurement, Order Management, Inventory Management, Cost Management, Supply Planning, Product Management 
 Understand business targets and strategy, as well as the technology opportunities to improve business needs 
 Fundamental knowledge of business and enterprise architecture 
 Very good verbal and written communication (english) 
 Holistic problem-solving approach and analytical mindset 
 High level of interpersonal skills 
 Very good at managing the matrix organization including key stakeholders 
 
 
 Key KPIs: 
 
 Business satisfaction in supporting and promoting business requirements 
 Delivered solutions adhere to the defined enterprise architecture and service catalogue of the business 
 
 
 What we offer: 
 At Securitas we believe in doing the right thing and doing it well. For our customers and our employees. Our employees come from all walks of life and bring with them a multitude of talents and perspectives. We aim for diverse representation throughout the company, and we are committed to equal pay, safe working conditions, gender balance and an inclusive work environment with a wide range of skills and development opportunities. 
 
  If it all sounds good for you, don’t hesitate and apply!

Vill du bli en del av ett team med engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare, och arbeta med de största och mest komplexa projekten i svensk industri? 
  Om tjänsten och företaget 
  Virtual Engineering  är ett framgångsrikt företag med medarbetare som har ett stort engagemang och hög kompetens inom Product Lifecycle Management. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och driva digital transformation och få spetskompetens inom PLM-System.     Virtual Engineering  erbjuder konsulttjänster inom PLM där man arbetar i uppdrag mot stora och välkända industrier för att utveckla samt leverera de bästa lösningarna för deras verksamhet. Som konsult så kommer du att hantera den digitala informationen för hela produktens livscykel. Från kravställning, till utveckling och sedan avveckling. 
  Du Erbjuds 
 
 Möjligheten till att bli en av de vassaste konsulterna inom PLM 
 Att arbeta i en familjär och öppen företagskultur  Mentorskap för att ge dig de bästa förutsättningarna att lyckas och utvecklas
  
 Om Rollen 
 Du kommer att få en tydlig utvecklingsplan samt en mentor. Du kommer i rollen som Business Analyst få arbeta i uppdrag ute hos kund där du till en början kommer att få ta del av företagets verksamhet för att sedan föreslå tekniska lösningar samt förbättringar. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande men kommer bland annat att innefatta: 
 
 Du bygger virtuella miljöer för att testa och verifiera produkterna för att snabbt få fram vilka produkter som ska implementeras i verksamheten. 
 Du arbetar med digitaliseringsresan utav produktutveckling. 
 Förbättringsarbeten kring hantering utav produktinformation 
 Samla in krav från verksamheten samt föreslå tekniska lösningar  Vara rådgivande för att kunna stötta och förbättra processer hos kund
  
 Vi söker dig    Vi tror att du är en lösningsorienterad och nyfiken individ som tycker om att lösa problem. Vi tror även att du: 
 
 Civilingenjörsexamen inom Maskinteknik, Farkostteknik, Industriell produktion eller motsvarande med intresse inom produktutveckling. 
 Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift 
 Grundläggande kunskaper inom programmering ex Java, Python eller C# 
 
 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har kommit i kontakt med PLM eller produktutveckling antingen via tidigare arbete samt att du har erfarenhet utav exempelvis en roll inom Mekanik och är intresserad utav att gå mot mer övergripande projektledning. 
  Som person tror vi att du är 
 
 Nyfiken 
 Lösningsorienterad 
 Teamplayer 
 
   Praktisk Information 
 Start: September eller enligt överenskommelse  Plats: Stockholm  Anställningsform: Detta uppdrag är ett konsultuppdrag med möjligheter till förlängning eller överrekrytering.    Du blir anställd av A-hub och arbetar som konsult hos Virtual Engineering.

    Position Overview:
    
 
 
 
 
    We are seeking an ESG Research Analyst to join our Norm-Based Research team in Stockholm. Our new team member will predominantly assess corporate controversies concerning global norms on human rights, while also contributing to our environmental protection, business malpractice and labour standards analyses.
    
 
 
 
 
    The Norm-Based Research team’s analyses assist investors in making decisions regarding companies’ alleged involvement in practices that conflict with international standards and guidelines, as recognized in the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC) and Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises. The team is based in Manila (Philippines), Mumbai (India) and Stockholm (Sweden).
    
 
 
 
    The successful candidate will be trained to work both independently and collaboratively with the team across different locations, conducting research on companies, relevant business activities and corporate controversies. Our new colleague will work with the team to draft research reports on these companies and contribute to the maintenance of high-quality ESG analyses. They will focus primarily on corporate controversies relating to alleged violations of global norms on human rights, as well as participate to similar assessments on environmental protection, business malpractice and labour standards. Key capabilities required for the role include solid research, analytical, writing and communication skills, as well as a keen eye for detail and a well-organized approach to independent and collaborative work in a team.
    
 
 
    Responsibilities:
    
 
 
 
 
 
      Conduct desk research into alleged corporate involvement in activities or practices that may conflict with established international standards and guidelines.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Review information presented by and engaging in dialogue with stakeholders and companies.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Write research reports on companies’ activities connected to violations of international norms.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Participate in the research peer review process.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Participate in and contribute to team processes focused on strengthening our ESG product offering.
      
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications:
    
 
    Professional skills and qualifications:
    
 
 
 
 
 
      Bachelor level degree or higher. Postgraduate degree in relevant field such as human rights, international relations, law, and/or humanities desirable.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      3 to 5 years of research experience or similar in human rights, preferably related to business and human rights, corporate social responsibility, ESG, and/or sustainability.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Good understanding of corporate controversies and international standards and guidelines for responsible business conduct. Previous experience or education in these areas desirable but not required.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Excellent language skills (fluency in English required. Additional languages are an asset).
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Solid writing and research skills, including the ability to produce deadline-driven basic and advanced analyses.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Strong interest in ESG, finance, and responsible investment.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Personal skills:
    
 
 
 
 
 
      Strong work ethic, with the ability to manage workload, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Excellent attention to detail, and a methodical and thorough approach to the task at hand.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Proactive attitude, with the ability to motivate others and foster a positive, collaborative working environment.
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Solid interpersonal skills, with the ability to work both independently and as part of an international team.

  What you can expect from us
  
 
  Our people are the moving force behind ISS STOXX. We are dedicated to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry and empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their career, health, financial and personal well-being.
  
 
 
  We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are invested in our people and are working every day to ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace.

  Let’s be #BrilliantTogether.
  
 
 
  About ISS STOXX
  
 
  ISS STOXX GmbH is a leading provider of research and technology solutions for the financial market. Established in 1985, we offer top-notch benchmark and custom indices globally, helping clients identify investment opportunities and manage portfolio risks. Our services cover corporate governance, sustainability, cyber risk, and fund intelligence. Majority-owned by Deutsche Börse Group, ISS STOXX has over 3,400 professionals in 33 locations worldwide, serving around 6,400 clients, including institutional investors and companies focused on ESG, cyber, and governance risk. Clients trust our expertise to make informed decisions for their stakeholders' benefit.
  
 
 
  ISS ESG solutions enable investors to develop and integrate sustainable investing policies and practices, engage on responsible investment issues, and monitor portfolio company practices through screening solutions. ISS ESG also provides climate data, analytics, and advisory services to help financial market participants understand, measure, and act on climate-related risks across all asset classes. In addition, ESG solutions cover corporate and country ESG research and ratings enabling its clients to identify material social and environmental risks and opportunities.

Graduate Programme Overview  If you're a recent graduate or soon-to-be graduate join us and unlock a world of carefully curated experiences, knowledge, and connections to shape your career. Along the way, you can expect all the training and support you need to make your mark on the world. Put simply, we’ll empower you to help determine how we do things and where we go next. Our graduates are a vital part of our success, and we welcome applications from people from all walks of life. Whoever you are and wherever you want to join us, if you’re curious, creative and ambitious, this is a world in which you can truly belong. 
  Why the Investment Banking Graduate programme?  Banking provides comprehensive financial advisory, capital raising, financing and risk management services to corporations, governments and financial institutions worldwide. We take an integrated approach to client coverage, providing our clients with access to bankers who have industry and geography specific expertise across all investment banking products. 
  As a Banking graduate, you will be working with our Coverage and Mergers and Acquisition teams. Here, you’ll come up with the answers to our clients’ most strategic questions. Advising a broad range of corporate clients, you’ll deliver holistic, structured solutions that help our clients deliver on their goals; whether that’s through mergers and acquisitions, capital raising, structured solutions or risk management. 
  After several weeks of intensive training to start, you’ll join one of our industry, product or geographic groups and start working on live deals and business development projects right away. Within small deal teams, you’ll quickly play an important role on a variety of demanding assignments. 
 
 
  You may work on: 
 
 Financial analysis and modelling 
 Valuation 
 Industry research 
 Business evaluation and strategic assessment 
 Business and idea generation 
 External and internal stakeholder communication 
 
 
  1-2 year targeted, fast-track programme focused on developing specialist technical expertise. 
  Investment Banking at Barclays  Barclays is one of the world’s top-tier investment banks. We are one of the only non-US, full-service rivals to the biggest US investment banks. And being headquartered in Europe gives us a unique advantage. We think and act differently. From Hong Kong to Houston, and Tel Aviv to Tokyo, everyone at Barclays enjoys a real sense of purpose, because they work for a business that fosters innovation, champions sustainability, and deploys finance responsibly for the common good and the long term. 
  Who we're looking for  To be considered for this programme, you must be motivated and curious with a degree or expected degree – in any area. Language requirements: fluent in English and one of the following languages: Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish. 
  Ideally, you will have an interest in business and finance, a good work ethic and be keen to learn and develop your skill set, allowing you to deliver the best products to our clients.    This role is deemed as a Controlled Function role under the Central Bank of Ireland Fitness and Probity Regulations and may require the role holder to hold mandatory regulatory qualifications or the minimum qualifications to meet internal company benchmarks. 
  Barclays Europe  We’ve had a presence in Europe almost as long as there’s been a Barclays. So, we’re building on solid foundations, leveraging our embedded talent, in 10 locations across the region allowing us to draw on a wealth of local and regional insight.     Working in Stockholm  Located in central Stockholm, our office is home to around 20 professionals covering the Nordic region. We provide global corporate, governmental and institutional clients with a full spectrum of strategic advisory, financing and risk management solutions. 
  Purpose of the role 
 To participate in the day-to-day activities of the investment banking division. Gain broad exposure to different types of clients, transactions and focus on specialist areas. 
 
  Accountabilities 
 
 Collaboration on live deals, client pitches, support the team with advising on a broad range of corporate clients, delivering holistic, structured solutions to deliver on client goals. 
 Collaboration with cross-functional teams to support business initiatives. 
 Participation in training and development programmes to enhance skills and knowledge.
