Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.
  
 
 
  Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations and the mission of the Data and Analytics craft is to turn that raw data into actionable insights.
  
 
 
  We are now looking for a  Senior Data Analyst  to join our flagship Angry Birds 2 game in the Stockholm studio. Coming into this role, you will build an understanding of the game and different business levers and use that knowledge to build new game features, optimising existing ones, structure vague problem statements in collaboration with stakeholders such as the Game lead, product managers, designers and producers.
  
 
 
  The team is located in our studio in the centre of Stockholm and works in a hybrid mode (2-3 days per week onsite). Currently not based in Sweden? No problem at all, we will help you with the relocation and work permit if needed!
  
 You will have impact and fun at work by: 
 
 Bringing an objective perspective and recommendations to all phases of decision making, leveraging your technical skills to mine raw data for valuable information 
 Constantly designing and running in-game A/B test experiments, helping the team to find options leading to better game monetization performance and our audience satisfaction 
 Creating dashboards and reports to help the game team understand your findings 
 Proactively working with data exploration and looking for opportunities to improve gameplay experience 
 Working closely with peer Data Analysts, Product Managers and Project Leads to continuously improve how we are interpreting game metrics and making decisions 
 Coaching and sharing best practices between colleagues in the data craft and whole game teams 
 
  Experience and skills we are looking for: 
 
 High proficiency in SQL 
 Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or R 
 Solid understanding of statistics 
 Experience in product analysis and experiments design including A/B testing 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Presentation and collaboration skills with proven ability to present data and provide actionable recommendations to senior stakeholders 
 Prior experience in mobile games or apps with large audiences will help you to hit the ground running but not a must 
 
 
 
  Please apply with your CV in English. We look forward to meeting you!
  
 
 
  We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name. 
 
 
 
  At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

  Hiring process at Rovio

job_title: Senior Principal Product Analyst | Candy Crush Saga
job_description:
Available in 5 locations
           
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
           Category
            Data, Analytics & Strategy
          
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
           Job ID
            R023226
          
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Regular
          
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Craft:  Data, Analytics & Strategy
       
  Job Description: 
 We are looking for a talented Senior Principal Product Analyst to push and deeply understand the performance of our game economy as part of the Candy Crush Saga team. You will get the opportunity to be part of a great team, working with an industry leading and genre defining game with over 200 million active players. 
 
  Your Role Within the Kingdom 
 
 As the Senior Principal Product Analyst, you are tasked with leading the charge in holistically understanding, analysing, and optimising our game economy. You will work cross-functionally with Product Managers, Game Economy/System Designers and Engineers to not only analyse current economic systems, but also innovate and guide implementation of solutions that boost player engagement. Your deep understanding of economy dynamics and analytics will be pivotal in crafting strategic insights that propel Candy Crush Saga to new heights. 
 
 This role is crucial for driving the analytical foundation of our game economy work, including strategy, experimentation cycles and delivery of actionable insights to have a positive impact on our understanding, decision-making, and ultimately our player satisfaction. 
  Key responsibilities: 
 
 Opportunity identification 
 
 Support the product area and growth via evaluation, performance reporting and data driven recommendations, including data and tech project coordination. 
 Identify data-driven opportunities for your team, fostering value creation and problem-solving without predefined solutions. 
 
 High quality analytics 
 
 Use knowledge about existing tools, methodologies and insights to both deepen analytical understanding and apply these to different problems. 
 Provide strategic actions based on insights from your expertise in business, industry trends and competitor landscape; drive business observability. 
 
 Managing workflow 
 
 Create and coordinate work smartly to deliver value continuously and mitigate risk independently. 
 Guide stakeholders and the data community in improving ways of working, support tools and processes, collaborating cross-functionally to guarantee value delivery. 
 
 Communication 
 
 Clearly communicate the findings of your analysis to colleagues, enabling them to utilize the insights for learning or decision-making. Clearly and concisely report results and progress, ensuring conclusions are drawn from transparently cited sources. 
 Foster strong relationships with other key functions across the business 
 
 
  Skills to Create Thrills 
 
 Comprehensive understanding of the dynamics of fast-paced economic systems, focusing on analysis and optimization. Ability to dissect complex economies to drive data-driven narratives and strategic decisions. 
 Expertise in handling analytically complex projects, from concept to execution. 
 Consistent track record as a key partner in cross-functional teams dedicated to developing economic systems or similar projects. 
 Highly proficient in SQL as well as sufficient skills in Python or R for numerical analysis. 
 Prior experience working directly with other peers in data science, engineering, consumer research, and business intelligence. 
 Masters’ or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experience. 
 
 
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. 
 
  About King 
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft. 
 
 
  A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes 
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community. 
 
  Making the World Playful 
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun? 
 
 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better. 
 
 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful. 
 
 Applications need to be in English.  Discover King at careers.king.com

Let's build the future together!   
 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and an ATS SaaS platform used by 9000+ companies and has users in 90 countries around the world . 
 Working at Teamtailor means working at a young, international, and fast-paced tech company that offers an ideal workplace for those who want to have a real impact on the growth of an organisation and are craving responsibilities. It also means having lots of fun! 
  In this role you will be responsible for building, configuring and automating technology solutions that drive business value ($$ or time-improvement) for 300+ CRM users (and growing rapidly) across Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Support. We are therefore looking for a real problem solver with exceptional project management skills that knows how Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Support works! 
 
  As a Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst at Teamtailor, you will be responsible for: 
  Platform Management:  Making sure that Salesforce always runs with the latest releases and manage all day-to-day functionalities, such as (but not limited to): 
 
 User and Access Management 
 Security 
 Technical setup (Fields, Objects, Report Types.. etc..) 
 Release Management 
 Change set deployments 
 Flows (!!!) 
 Basically almost everything that happens in Salesforce Setup 
 
  Improving Commercial processes:  Use Tech to improve real business challenges 
 
 Improve the efficiency of business operations by proactively undertaking regular process analysis and documentation. 
 Solve business problems using the Salesforce Platform. 
 Create human-centred user experiences in Salesforce. 
 Manage changes to business processes, technology, and people within Salesforce. 
 Create, maintain, and enhance automated business processes. 
 
  Data Management:  Make sure that data enters/leaves the platform deduplicated, accurately and actionable. 
 
 Create processes to ensure data in Salesforce is managed correctly. 
 Manage the information architecture and ensure that information flows accurately between internal objects and external systems. 
 
  Project Management:  Plan and oversee Salesforce projects to ensure they’re completed on time and within budget. 
  Data Steward:  Proactively set up processes to manage and protect customer and business data and be the point of contact for the DPO. 
 
   Additionally, we are looking for someone who has:   
 
 At least 3+ years of experience Salesforce Administration 
 Thorough understanding of Salesforce Governor Limits 
 Good understanding of Salesforce integration possibilities 
 Understands Commercial GTM strategies. You understand how Marketing attracts prospective customers, how sales closes deals, how CSM teams prevent churn and how Support delivers exceptional service  (we prefer a person who has a bit of trouble configuring a http callout in a flow, but knows exactly how Sales work, rather than someone who knows exactly how to configure a http callout in a flow but doesn’t know how sales sells) . 
 Experience managing projects from inception to completion. 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. 
 Salesforce Administrator certification 
 
 
  Want to see what Teamtailor is? Here is a short product video   
 
    If this sounds like you, then you know what to do! 
 We look forward to receiving your application.

Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.
  
 
 
  With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.
  
 
 
  This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.
  
 
 
  About the role
  
 
  This role will be part of Northern Europe Digital & Tech Business Unit team primarily working on executing technology initiatives identified via demand management process. The initiatives can be pertaining to commercial applications (global & local), ERP, data and analytics, marketing effectiveness, digital, etc.
  
 
 
  This role will also support operational effectiveness within the market by acting as an escalation point for any operational issues and collaborating it with Service Assurance team. In this position, you will also support portfolio management activities.
  
 
 
  Key responsibilities
  
 
 To work with the BU Tech and key BU/Market business stakeholders to ensure the successful and on-time deployment of Tech global initiatives, adopton of tech products & delivery of benefits. 
 Ensure that all project/product business analyses (value assessment) and other activities necessary to build Business Case, global funding artefacts, etc. are delivered. 
 Responsible to define problem statement and involve proper Tech and non-Tech stakeholders, specialists and Business Consultants necessary to deliver Business Case. 
 Follow global tech portfolio and standard to define problem statement and involve proper Tech and non-Tech stakeholders, external partners to deliver Business Case, control budget and ensure successful project delivery. 
 Deconstruct complex processes into manageable simplified representations that facilitate strategic discussion and decision making. 
 To ensure operational support services are delivered for both global & local application portfolio and manage relation with global tech product teams and external partners. 
 
 
 
  Qualifications and skills
  
 
  Essential
  
 
 Minimum 2-years work experience in area of Technology, business analyst, project or product management. 
 Broad knowledge and understanding of Tech systems & Business processes such as SAP, Net Revenue Management, Commercial Excellence, data framework and how they apply, or could be applied. 
 Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the Project Management / Agile methodologies & DIGITAL technologies. 
 Familiar with the concepts, standards, technology, tools, processes, procedures, hardware, software and services in use for delivering information services. 
 
 
 
  Preferred
  
 
 Good influencing, communication, and team-working skills at all levels 
 Strong stakeholder management skills and must be able to develop effective relationships with internal TECH product managers / external service where appropriate. 
 Technically oriented analytical mindset and problem-solving skills, along with experience of applying industry standard business analysis approaches (including but not limited to brainstorming, interviewing, requirements sessions and use cases) 
 Must be able to work with minimal supervision. Ability to plan own work to meet objectives, and to work independently. 
 
 
 
  Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
  
 
  At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
  
 
 
  We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
  
 
 
  We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
  
 
  Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/    At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.    As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.    Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.    Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, Haleon may be required to capture and report expenses Haleon incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure Haleon’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.

job_title: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Market Strategy
job_description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company that powers meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice, and email. We help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences across all customer touchpoints. Over 150,000 businesses, including many of the world’s largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.  We dream big—for our company, our customers, and our employees—and hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. With nearly 4,500 Sinchers in over 60 countries, probably somewhere we near you!  About the role  Sinch is expanding its global Product & Partner Marketing team and building a new Market Strategy team. We are currently recruiting for a Senior Product Marketing Manager, Market Strategy. Reporting to the Director of Market and Solution Strategy, this role involves working closely with the Director to shape and implement Sinch's market approach and positioning. The role involves developing a deep understanding of market dynamics and buyer behaviors. The individual will work closely with senior stakeholders across the business to ensure that market strategies are robust and product narratives are compelling and effective.    Key responsibilities: 
 
 Market Research & Analysis: Lead comprehensive market research initiatives to gain insights into market trends, competitor strategies, and customer needs. Apply this information to inform strategic decisions and identify new growth opportunities. 
 Segmentation & Targeting: Define and refine market segmentation and buyer personas to effectively target and engage key customer segments. 
 Strategic Product Narrative: Develop and refine our cross-product and platform positioning. Craft compelling narratives that highlight the unique value propositions of Sinch’s offerings. Ensure these narratives are effectively communicated through thought leadership, analyst relations, and industry associations. 
 Industry Expertise: Provide deep industry knowledge to support go-to-market strategies and launch plans. Stay current with industry trends and developments to keep our offerings competitive. 
 Collaboration & Leadership: Work closely with internal teams, including product management, marketing, and sales, to align strategies and drive execution. Mentor and guide junior team members to achieve departmental goals. 
  About you  To excel in this role, the candidate should be a commercially driven product marketer with a strategic mindset and hands-on expertise. Effective communication tailored to various stakeholders, combined with a balance of critical thinking and data-driven insights, is essential. The ideal person thrives in a fast-paced, global environment and enjoys team collaboration.  You should have/be  
 
 At least 7 years of experience in market strategy, product marketing, or a related field within the technology or communications industry. 
 Proven experience managing complex projects and leading cross-functional initiatives. 
 Strong understanding of market research methodologies, competitive analysis (including win/loss programs), and buyer personas. 
 Expertise in creating effective cross-product positioning and narratives, with experience in marketing platforms and multi-persona products. 
 Experience with analyst relations, including managing large market reports like Gartner MQ, Forrester Wave, and IDC Marketscape. 
 Experience gathering and analyzing competitive insights and running win/loss programs. 
 Strong data analysis skills, with the ability to bring data and insights to bear in telling a story; experience with BI tools and/or SQL is a plus. 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively to senior leadership and industry analysts. 
 Ability to balance critical thinking with a data-driven approach, while also being dynamic and pragmatic. 
 Experience working collaboratively in a fast-paced, global environment. 
 Comfortable working with distributed teams across multiple regions and time zones. 
 Willing to travel if needed. 
  Our commitment  We strive to cultivate a motivated and hardworking team in a welcoming and diverse workplace. Our core values—Dream Big, Win Together, Keep It Simple, and Make It Happen—form the basis for a culture that encourages innovative thinking and drives improved business outcomes through diverse perspectives and skills.  The path to success is always upward, and opportunities are closer than you think. It’s time to chase answers, tackle challenges, and follow your dreams.  Ready to join us on this journey? Apply now!  If this role isn’t what you’re looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: Sinch Careers

ABOUT THE JOB 
 As a Senior Business Analyst//PIM Consultant, you have the responsibility to advise our customers in optimizing their data and processes. You will be analyzing and configuring Product Information Management (PIM) or Digital Asset Management (DAM) systems to optimize through a well-defined strategy for business and IT architecture. You are a driving factor in securing robust and scalable solutions. With your technical knowledge, you dive into IT architecture and discuss issues with developers. You will interact with a lot of stakeholders within your workday – both customers and colleagues – which requires planning and coordination to secure the best solution and process. In this role, you will work on projects with large customers - spending time in our office in Stockholm but also on the customer site and with our colleagues in Denmark, Portugal, Serbia and India. 
  Your primary tasks will be: 
 
 Advisory of customers regarding optimizations, process design, data set-up, and solutions within the master data domains 
 Strategy and architecture for PIM/DAM including integration with external systems for example Middleware, ERP, DAM, PLM and CMS. 
 Be able to lead a consultant team in the execution of stand-alone pre-analysis projects or larger technical implementations 
 Participate in sales pitches 
 Participate in cross-competency projects as a master data specialist 
 Facilitate workshops, specify solutions, estimate scope 
 Be a good communicator 
 
 YOUR PROFILE 
 We imagine that you are used to bridging IT and Business and would like to further develop those competencies. As we are looking for a Senior Business Analyst/PIM Consultant, we expect you to have some years, w you have been working with customers and advising in IT, data, reporting, business analysis, process optimization or similar. 
 It is a prerequisite that you have experience within: 
 
 Change management and Stakeholder management 
 Process analysis and governance 
 General knowledge of IT architecture 
 
 
 It is an advantage if you have experience in project management and e-commerce – but not a requirement. 
 As a person, you have a natural flair for acquiring business knowledge and converting it to solution designs. You create structure and are systematic in a changeable workday with many different activities. You are curious – listen and ask questions, quality minded and ambitious. You are a team player and contribute to informal work culture and value open and honest communication. 
 
  LIFE AT IMPACT 
 For more than 20 years, IMPACT has pioneered some of the most advanced commerce solutions in the Nordics. What started in Aarhus, Denmark has grown into a European powerhouse with offices across the world – see our different locations. 
 While we cover all the major tech platforms and work with some of the most exciting businesses, we make a sincere effort to stay down-to-earth. It’s who we are, and it’s the kind of talent we want to attract. We empower people and businesses to drive positive change and quality experiences, and we’re not afraid to take the lead on shaping the future of commerce. Check out our cases. 
 Today, we’re a global team of digital talents working to strategize, craft, and support all things tech. We push the boundaries for commerce with curiosity, ambition, and empowerment that cements the ambition to  change commerce for the better . But it’s not all about size. Because more than anything, we want to maintain our collective can-do attitude that creates a working environment w everything is possible – and have fun while doing it. 
 
 
 CONTACT 
 Send your CV. Interviews are held on an ongoing basis, as the position is to be filled as soon as possible. 
 If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact D2C Brand Unit delivery manager, Peter Wiklund at peter.wiklund@impactcommerce.se. 
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! 
 
 
   
 
 
 
 
    Locations
    
 
    Stockholm

Welcome to SVT Play and the Apple Team! As a developer here, you will work with great people, new tech and in a creative and learning environment. You and your team will focus on enhancing the SVT Play app on Apple devices.     WHAT WE OFFER  SVT Play is Sweden's leading video service, reaching millions weekly. Our mission gives us a unique opportunity to put the user at the center, thereby creating a fantastic TV experience – in the service of the public. The Play Apple Team is dedicated to delivering high-quality apps, a source of pride for us. 
 We strive to create an inclusive and engaging workplace within the media tech landscape. Our belief in autonomous teams and the freedom to select tools and work methodologies drives our innovative spirit. We are a organization with clear goals where we share successes and setbacks, and where learning is seen as an important part of succeeding. No day is like the other, making everyday life eventful.     ABOUT THE ROLE  As a developer for SVT Play’s Apple apps, you will work with the SVT Play app on iOS and tvOS. Every day is unique, making work here dynamic. You will be part of an organization that highly values your skills and expertise. The team has the freedom to explore and use new technology when appropriate, focusing on innovation. The team takes responsibility for its own processes and mob programming is a work method that is used often. 
 The position is a permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning), with a start as soon as possible.     ABOUT YOU  We are looking for a down-to-earth, communicative, and pragmatic person who can challenge us with new perspectives! You have a great understanding of modern development and a great interest in technology. You like to work in a team with an agile and experimental mindset and have a hunger to evolve, learn and share.    We believe you have a few years of experience working with iOS/tvOS. For this role, it is important to have deep knowledge of Swift and SwiftUI, and if you have some experience with Swift Concurrency, that would be beneficial.     ABOUT THE TEAM AND WORKPLACE  The Play Apple Team consists of four iOS/tvOS developers. The team can be seen as a subteam that is included in a bigger team constellation that includes all the other platforms where you can find SVT Play, such as web, SmartTV/HbbTV and Android apps. This bigger team has one product owner and also dedicated UX, AD, QA and analyst. In your role as a developer you will closely collaborate with all those competences, and also with people from other teams.    We think it's important to have fun together and we nurture personal development through conferences, hack days, technical guilds and bi-annual tech sprints. We are humble, respect each other, and everyone is highly engaged in our products. Learn more about us on our tech blog here.    We work both at the office and remotely, but for this role, the better part of the work week will be spent on site at our newly renovated office in the TV building at Gärdet in Stockholm.     HOW TO APPLY 
 SVT collaborates with WE:SOURCE for this recruitment. We will be taking a summer break, and during this period the recruitment process will be paused, and feedback on applications will be delayed until August. For more information about the position, you are warmly welcome to contact recruitment consultant Kajsa-Stina Åkerblom at 076-050 11 01 or at kajsa-stina.akerblom@we-source.se. 
 Apply here 
 Position: Full-time (100%)

Aurobay  has over  hundred years of heritage in creating premium quality engines. With homes in Sweden and China, we have a strong reputation for pioneering practices in the automotive industry. We pride ourselves in our attention to detail and commitment to excellence . 
 This role as a Business Support Analyst offers a dynamic opportunity to work closely with both the Corporate Office team and the Executive Management Team. The Business Support Analyst will support the company by providing key analysis in business cases, product strategy, and investment evaluations. The role involves preparing presentations, conducting ad-hoc analysis, and assisting with management meetings. The ideal candidate will have strong financial and organizational skills to contribute to strategic decision-making and support the company's key initiatives. 
  What we offer 
 In addition to a competitive salary, a great location on Lindholmen or Skövde, and a genuine work-life balance, we provide the following benefits: 
 
 A yearly wellness contribution of SEK 5 000 for your physical and mental wellbeing. 
 
 
 A personal and professional development scheme to support your growth. 
 
 
 Additional pension funding. 
 
 
 Competitive additional and full coverage insurance.     Skills and Experience 
 A master's degree in business, economics, or engineering. 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on data-driven decision-making. 
 Proficient in basic financial modeling, data analysis, and supporting strategic planning efforts, with a strong willingness to learn and grow. 
 Collaborative spirit to work with cross-functional teams on strategic initiatives. 
 Proven experience in creating, organizing, and presenting communication materials effectively. 
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint. 
 
   Your role at Aurobay 
  As a Business Support Analyst you will: 
 
 Provide ad-hoc business support, analysis, and research. 
 Assist in the creation and structuring of business cases, including research, data collection, and analysis. 
 Perform financial analysis and modeling to evaluate the potential impact of proposed projects and initiatives. 
 Coordinate with project managers, finance, and other departments to ensure timely completion of business case deliverables. 
 Develop material and presentations for the company, both for internal and external use. 
 
 Equal opportunities employer  
 We are an equal opportunities employer. We encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply, especially women, people from ethnic minority backgrounds, and people with disabilities. Research has shown that women and people from ethnic minority backgrounds are less likely to apply if they don't match 100% of the criteria. As a company, we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. If you believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Let's explore the possibilities together. 
 How to apply  
 Deadline to submit your application is  September  30  but the selection process will be running continuously. Please note that due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.   We can’t wait to see what you can bring to our team! 
 Questions   
 If you have any additional questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Martin Svegander, martin.svegander@aurobay.com 
 For questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter Louise Mårdholm, louise.mardholm@aurobay.com 
  Questions concerning trade union: 
 Unionen : Ordf Joakim Dahlin, joakim.dahlin@aurobay.com 
  Ledarna:  Ordf Håkan Modigh, hakan.modigh@aurobay.com 
  Akademikerna:  Ordf. Fredrik Fantenberg, fredrik.fantenberg@aurobay.com 
  IF Metall:  Ordf Marko Borg Peltonen, marko.borg.peltonen@aurobay.com

Change people’s lives and love what you do! Cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. As a top 100 medical device company and market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a Cochlear-branded cochlear implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives.
  
 
 
  The Opportunity
  
 
 
  Cochlear has an opportunity for a R-619890 Labelling Requirements Analyst based in our Goteborg, Sweden office. In this role, the successful R-619890 Labelling Requirements Analyst leads and coordinates the lifecycle of labelling requirements and involves close interaction with product development teams and global and regional regulatory and marketing functions.
  
 
  Responsibilities include:
  
 
 
 
    Be familiar with all sources of medical device labelling requirements including global and regional medical device standards and regulations. Review these standards and regulations for specific labelling requirements.
    
 
 
    Review product requirements and derive specific labelling requirements.
    
 
 
    Create and maintain templates for requirements documents, protocols and reports that meet all essential regulatory needs.
    
 
 
    Participate and lead change and improvement initiatives with particular emphasis on the adoption or creation of best-in-class processes and tools to ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards for labelling.
    
 
 
    Implement Cochlear’s quality system through complying with and helping to enforce standard policies and procedures.
    
 
 
 
  What makes this opportunity unique?
  
 
  The role requires awareness of a rapidly changing regulatory environment and proactive participation and leadership of key process improvement initiatives for Cochlear to consistently meet global and regional regulatory labelling requirements. This role provides the Opportunity to work within large, multi-disciplinary implantable medical device projects.
  
 
 
  About You
  
 
  To add value to Cochlear in this role, you'll be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:
  
 
 
  Minimum:
  
 
 Experience in analysing and developing requirements in a product development environment 
 Proven elicitation skills to capture accurate and actionable requirements for ambiguous and complex projects 
 Strong influencing skills in a matrix work environment 
 Experience delivering to tight timelines 
 Ability to manage stakeholders across the business and lead cross-functional collaborations 
 Strong business analysis skills 
 Degree or higher qualification and/or equivalent experience, preferably in the technical, regulatory or medical field 
 Experience in using requirement gathering tools and writing requirement specifications 
 
 
 
  Ideal:
  
 
 Experience working in highly regulated multi-national medical device environments 
 Understands the specific needs for creating effective and compliant user documentation and labels 
 Experience in conducting systematic verification of technical documentation 
 
 
 
  A Little About Cochlear
  
 
 
  Cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. Around the world, more people chose a Cochlear-branded hearing implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives. Learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping people to Hear Now. And Always. Cochlear is the global market leader in implantable hearing solutions including cochlear implant systems (CI) and bone anchored hearing aids (Baha™).
  
 
 
  #cochlearcareers #TogetherCochlear

Who are we looking for? We are looking for someone that understands the value of getting things right from the start and has a passion for understanding the needs of the business and getting the details right. A person having: . High business and customer focus with a drive for results .   Ability to collaborate cross functionally and build network . Problem solving attitude . Good communication skills and an ability to express complex ideas in a simple way . Experience of working with waterfall and agile methodologies .   Automotive experience and knowledge of automotive industry regulations and standards is a significant plus . Genuine interest in developing an in-depth understanding of the product compliance domain, from a business and IT perspective . Facilitation and presentation/pedagogical skills . Curiosity, pro-activity and skills to connect the dots You will be part of a team that is aiming to be high performing and inclusive, at the same time as we are enjoying work.   We will welcome you in that team and want you to be part of our journey.

The Opportunity 
  The purpose of the domain of Product Lifecycle Domain is to deliver digital solutions supporting the creation and life cycle management of the product, as well as the order-to-delivery value stream. From customer order, production planning, and manufacturing execution to the delivered cars, we secure the industrial flows with smart digital solutions. This is a newly established domain that will grow over time. 
 Within the Product Lifecycle domain, we are establishing a Planning & Order Scheduling Team that will be responsible for the entire End-to-End planning process (Sales & Demand Planning, Supply Planning & Production Planning as well as Order Scheduling). New solutions and critical capabilities will have to be stepwise established according to the cycle plan to enable the next step in Polestar’s growth. 
 
   The Role 
 In this role, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, optimizing, and supporting the business processes related to planning. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that business requirements are clearly defined, understood, and translated into effective solutions that align with the organization's goals. 
 Further on, you will: 
 
 Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements. 
 Work closely with Functional Consultants and Solution Architects to support the design, configuration, testing, and deployment of new planning capabilities. 
 Analyze current planning processes, identify areas for improvement, and recommend solutions that enhance efficiency, accuracy, and alignment with business objectives. 
 Provide training and support to end-users on new planning processes and systems, ensuring a smooth transition and adoption of new solutions. 
 Develop and maintain detailed documentation of business processes, requirements, and system configurations to support ongoing maintenance and future enhancements. 
 
 
   The Ideal Candidate 
  We are looking for you who believe that openness and collaboration are key to success. You are a proactive and dynamic ‘’doer’’ who works strategically at the same time. It comes naturally to you to see the holistic picture quickly. 
 To be a great fit for this position we believe you have: 
 
 End User experience from SAP IBP or other similar planning tools 
 Strong understanding of planning processes, supply chain management, and ERP systems (such as SAP IBP, SAP S/4HANA). 
 Ability to thoroughly understand system setup, including integrations, master data usage, and overall architecture, to effectively support and optimize the solution. 
 Have a minimum of +3 years of experience in functional implementation of Planning and ERP systems (preferable in SAP IBP & S/4 SCM Modules) 
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. 
 Ability to independently manage tasks and sub-projects 
 Experience in the automotive industry 
 
 At Polestar, you will be part of a cross-functional and international team, with English as a natural language for written and spoken communication. Since Polestar’s in a scale-up phase you thrive by working in a fast-paced environment. 
 
   People at Polestar 
 We know that a change is needed. We also know that each one of us can help bring about that change. Our commitment to becoming climate-neutral by 2040 is just as important to us as being inclusive, diverse, and innovative. Together, we are creating, collaborating, and experimenting to usher in a new era of sustainable mobility. 
 We are an electric performance brand, determined to improve the society we live in.

Job Title:  SuccessFactors Employee Central - Business Analyst   Location:  Gothenburg   Language:  English   Experience:  Senior 
 Beyond Tech is looking for a Business Analyst to strengthen the team. As part of the team, you will be developing system support for processes that are at the very core of the HR. While you will most often connect with stakeholders within HR and Digital, the team's delivery contributes to projects across the organization. Requirement and solution discussions will be part of your daily work, as well as coordination of initiatives inside and beyond the area. To be able to analyze requirements and test solutions independently, you should already be comfortable navigating the system. 
 A must-have requirement for this job: 
 
 Solid knowledge in and experience from SuccessFactors Employee Central. 
 It would be a big bonus if you are certified in Employee Central, but a deep experience as a super user or similar could be an alternative. 
 
 You also have: 
 
 Skills and experience in information models and end-to-end process mapping including user journeys/UX 
 Worked in projects and/or a product context with implementation and enhancements of digital solutions where you have translated business needs to process and configuration solutions 
 The ability to apply business analysis in an agile context and write epics, features, and stories in an effective format 
 Great facilitation skills 
 
  You would be the ideal candidate if you also: 
 
 Have experience from other SuccessFactors modules 
 Have experience in project management/coordination 
 Have experience from the Human Resource business domain 
 Have relevant certificates from the business analysis area e.g., BABOK, Six Sigma 
 
 We would love to hear from you if you are interested in joining our team and contributing to our mission of innovation and excellence. Please send your resume and cover letter for consideration to  anu@beyondtech.se .

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match. 
 
  Electromobility is changing the automotive world, and we are now looking for you who want to be part of this change happening in our industry! The Electromobility organization is responsible for the complete development lifecycle of our electric powertrains – from advanced engineering through product development into the maintenance phase. Together we drive the transition from conventional powertrains to electromobility based on cutting-edge engineering, state-of-the-art research, and well-proven technology within the Volvo Group. By joining us, you’ll be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other, and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win. 
 
  We at Volvo Group are constantly moving and changing to be one step ahead in the technology journey. Within Volvo Group Trucks Technology, we are adapting and challenging ourselves to be able to develop new breakthrough transport solutions. We strive to add value and the best solutions to our customers while being energy efficient, sustainable, and safer for society. That’s the reason we are looking for an experienced data analyst with a passion for Analytics and Data Science. 
 
  We also believe you are a curious person and want to go from idea to practice. You will be involved in developing our products by discovering the information hidden in vast amounts of data from primarily our electrical vehicles. 
  Role Summary: 
  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting Electromobility product development and evolution. By leveraging historical data and prediction models, you will communicate valuable insights. Your core responsibilities will include ensuring data collection and quality, contributing to the establishment of a robust data infrastructure, data visualization, statistical analysis, collecting and cleaning data, processing large datasets, descriptive analytics, and diagnostic analytics.     Key Responsibilities: 
 
 
  Move beyond compiling data to help tell the story behind the numbers by combining the right visuals and narrative with relevant data to stimulate new perspectives and drive change. 
 Use reporting and visualization to create answers to questions we haven't yet asked, demonstrating a passion for uncovering connections that may not be immediately clear to others. 
 Serve as a data advocate, eager to learn and share best practices across the Volvo Group. 
 Enrich the existing landscape of data sources by identifying critical information needs and connecting them into our models through cross-functional partnership and collaboration. 
 Work with high-resolution data from test- and customer vehicles to understand usage and support engineers with product development. 
 Collaborate and network with stakeholders within and outside Volvo. 
 Identify and integrate existing and new data by working closely with the engineering team and various stakeholders to improve product and service capabilities. 
 
 
 
  Technical Requirements: 
 
 
  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related fields. 
 Minimum 3 years of experience working in data analytics, particularly as a data analyst/scientist within the Automotive Industry. 
 Experience in driving and implementing Analytics/Data Science insights, preferably in a global environment. 
 Proficient with relevant technical tools, platforms, and systems such as Python, GitHub, Cloud Analytics, SQL, Data Bricks, KNIME, Power BI, etc. 
 Experience working with Spark and high-resolution time series data. 
 Knowledge of data communication, telematics, and truck services is a bonus. 
 Understanding of internal Volvo data flow is a bonus. 
 Experience in analytics from the service and aftermarket business in the transport industry is a bonus. 
 
 
  If you are passionate about promoting collaboration and understanding in the workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive and supportive environment, we would love to hear from you!  We look forward to recieve your application!     Last application date : 15 October, 2024 
  Curious and want to know more about the role? Please feel free to reach out me! 
  Sina Ghaedian, Group Manager - Data Analytics team at Electromobility  E-mail Adress: sina.ghaedian@volvo.com, 
 
  We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail. 
 
  Who we are and what we believe in  Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide. 
 
  Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join  Volvo Group . Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities. 
 
  Group Trucks Technology  are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions. 
 
 
 What YOU WILL EXPERIENCE IN THIS POSITION: 
 
 In this position of Proposal / Design Engineer you will serve various industries like the Renewables, Chemicals, Pharmaceutical, Power, Oil & Gas and Datacenters. The role will involve the estimating and the creation of MRO proposals as well as the preparing of design documents for electrical heat tracing projects. 
 
  RESPONSIBILITIES IN THIS POSITION: 
 
 In this position, you will be responsible for: 
 
 Assessment of RFQ’s: 
    
 Review and analyze received requests for quotation both technically and commercially; 
 Develop bid strategy and subsequent implementation in conjunction with our sales teams; 
 Understand what the competition will offer to meet the same client requirements and how they will meet these requirements; 
 
 Support: 
    
 Attend bid clarification and project meetings where required. 
 Provide technical support and follow up on proposals; 
 
 Prepare: 
    
 Estimates including cost-models; 
 Put the proposal together including the writing of various sections based on “prepare to win” practices applied within our company; 
 Prepare Engineering and Design documentation. 
 
 
 
 
 You have: 
 
 
 Academic background in Electrical/ Mechanical Engineering 
 Minimum of 3 years of previous experience in a proposal/ engineering role (preferably within the Process industry) 
 Skills: 
    
 Quick learner. 
 High level of accuracy and proficiency in processing data 
 Computer literate – proficient in a wide variety of MS Office programs (Word – Intermediate User, Excel – Advanced User , Outlook – Intermediate User) 
 Languages: 
      
 English and Swedish language skills, both written and verbal. 
 
 Some knowledge of power distribution and/ or Heat Tracing Applications. 
 Previous experience of preparing the commercial bid analysis, working closely with engineering department nVent Thermal in the competition of the bid analyst summary. 
 Full clean driving license. 
 Be a self-starter / self-motivated, detail orientated and a good communicator (both written and oral) 
 Understand technically in-depth Industrial Heat Solutions (IHS) product lines and relevant (Special) Applications for which they can be used. 
 Analyze customer provided data and develop technical solutions that exceed client expectations whilst enhancing nVent Thermal Management chances of securing best Project Margin 
 Interpret P&ID, line lists, plot plans, piping isometrics, piping plan drawings, piping/electrical/insulation specifications, and bill of materials. 
 Produce calculations and Heat tracing Designs using in-house design software. 
 
 
 
 
 Abilities to meet the physical and environmental demands: 
    
 Working under pressure. 
 The work will be in a typical office environment. 
 Some assignments may require occasional travelling for customer visits (<10% of time). 
 
 
 
 #LI- CP1 
 #LI-Hybrid 
 
 WE HAVE:  
 
 A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day 
    
 At nVent, we believe safer systems ensure a more secure world. We connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. We design, manufacture, market, install and service high-performance products and solutions for mission-critical equipment, buildings and essential processes. Our solutions are helping build a more sustainable and electrified world. 
 We are a $3.3B company with a dedicated team of more than 11,000 employees around the globe. Our comprehensive portfolio of enclosures, electrical and fastening, and thermal management solutions dates back more than 100 years and includes nVent CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, ILSCO, RAYCHEM and SCHROFF. 
 
 
 
 
 Commitment to strengthen communities where our employees live and work 
    
 We encourage and support the philanthropic activities of our employees worldwide 
 Through our nVent in Action matching program, we provide funds to nonprofit and educational organizations where our employees volunteer or donate money 
 
 
 
 
 Core values that shape our culture and drive us to deliver the best for our employees and our customers. We’re known for being: 
    
 Innovative & adaptable 
 Dedicated to absolute integrity 
 Focused on the customer first 
 Respectful and team oriented 
 Optimistic and energizing 
 Accountable for performance 
 
 
 
 
 Benefits to support the lives of our employees 
 
 
 At nVent, we connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. People are our most valuable asset. Inclusion and diversity means that we celebrate and encourage each other’s authenticity because we understand that uniqueness sparks growth.

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match. 
 At Advanced Engineering & Platform Studies, you will contribute to the transformation of our company, the transport industry, and society at large. You will take part in the development of new transport solutions aimed at enhancing customer productivity and sustainability. As a Product Architect - Transport Solutions, you will be responsible for planning customer use cases involving comprehensive combination tests in customer operations. These tests need to be meticulously planned, followed up, and feedback provided to the customer. 
 In this role, you will work closely with other product architects, technology innovators, and customers. You will lead technology leapers working with follow-up of ongoing work packages and manage the documentation of the scope of the work packages. This position is temporary but offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact. 
  Your responsibilities will include: 
 
 Planning: Ensure that work packages are followed up in a timely manner. 
 
 
 Leading: Lead and instruct Technology leapers in their work. Securing access to systems and data. Informing about working methods etc. 
 
 
 Documentation: Keep documentation of the scope of the different work packages in the team. Including: 
 
 
 Purpose Documentation: Clearly document the purpose of each work package. 
 
 
 Completion Criteria: Document criteria for when a work package is considered ready. 
 
  Who Are You? 
 Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, you will bring: 
 
 Experience: Proven experience in working with the follow-up of High Capacity Transports, including data collection and analysis from transport missions. 
 
 
 Participation: Active involvement in the Technology Leap program over the past two years. 
 
 
 Communication Skills: Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and customers. 
 
  What’s In It For You? 
 We offer a comprehensive package of compensation and benefits. Additionally, you will enjoy: 
 
 Teamwork: Working in a team of innovative engineers who are passionate about teamwork and transport efficiency. 
 
 
 Insight: Gaining valuable insights into the world of product development. 
 
 
 Experience: Working closely with the product and customer operations, providing you with extensive knowledge and experience in the transport sector. 
 
 
  Ready for the Next Move? 
 If you want to make a real impact in your career, the transportation business is where you want to be. We look forward to meeting you.  This role is a temporary position with end date 20250630. 
 
  If you have any questions, please contact me: 
 Erik Bergkvist, Manager AE & Platform Studies EU, erik.bergkvist@volvo.com 
  We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail. 
 
  Who we are and what we believe in  Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide. 
 
  Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join  Volvo Group . Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities. 
 
  Group Trucks Technology  are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

job_title: Business Analyst inom IT och digitalisering
job_description:
Vi på Nexer Group, fd Sigma IT, utökar och söker fler stjärnor som vill bli en del av vår enhet IT Management! Brinner du för IT utveckling, kravhantering, digitalisering och är samtidigt nyfiken på konsultrollen? Vi söker nu dig som vill vidareutvecklas i din roll genom ett varierande arbete hos våra olika kunder och där du får möjligheten att bygga din kunskapsbank och dela med dig av din egen. Låter det intressant? Då är du troligen vår nästa Business Analyst!     
 Rollen som Business Analyst  För oss är det viktigt att du får utvecklas till ditt bästa jag. Genom vårt koncept BA by Nexer får du möjlighet att utveckla din Business Analysis- kompetens och testa på olika roller så som Scrum Master, Product Owner, Business Architect, Requirement Manager och mycket mer. Om du i stället önskar specialisera dig inom Business Analysis eller något annat område har vi möjlighet att erbjuda dig utbildningar och certifieringar genom Nexer Academy, du får också möjligheten att bredda din erfarenhet mot olika spännande branscher. 
 Som Business Analyst får du arbeta med varierande uppdrag hos kunder i Göteborgsområdet, med fokus på att hjälpa verksamheten att omvandla idéer och strategier till reell IT- nytta. Du kommer få agera som expert i ett av våra kunduppdrag och arbetar med ett eller flera områden som nulägesanalyser, processkartläggning, förändringsledning, kravställning, kravanalys, agila roller, dokumentation och förmedling. Rollen passar dig som har lätt att förstå och sätta dig in i komplexa miljöer, har god kommunikationsförmåga, kan arbeta med flera stakeholders för att förstå deras behov och omsätta till krav, facilitera workshops, god dokumentationsförmåga samt tycker om att verka i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och IT. Du arbetar självständigt med att driva in insamling av användarnas behov och kommer proaktivt med förslag på lösningar som skapar reell nytta. 
  Är vi rätt för dig?  Vill du tillhöra ett entreprenörsdrivet och familjärt bolag med stor passion, tror vi att vi kan vara rätt plats för dig. Vi har ett starkt driv och arbetar alltid ”upwards & onwards”, samtidigt som vi har ett jordnära förhållningssätt. 
 På Nexer och enheten West Strategy vill vi erbjuda dig möjligheten att utvecklas i den riktning du önskar, både personligen och i din roll. Du ingår i ett erfaret och passionerat team där det finns utrymme för kunskapsutbyte, och du får regelbunden uppföljning av din utveckling med din närmsta chef som coachar dig framåt. Hos oss kan du räkna med en trygg anställning och vi är ett bolag som förstår vikten av en god work- life- balance. I vårt förmånspaket erbjuder vi många attraktiva förmåner t.ex våra Passion Days, extra lediga dagar att ta ut när du behöver för att ägna tid åt något som du brinner för. Vi har kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag, ersättning vid föräldraledighet med mera. 
 För att både bibehålla och utveckla den atmosfär vi har idag arrangerar vi även regelbundet sociala aktiviteter för att få träffas och umgås, tex genom målresor, spelkvällar, bowling, klättring och andra trevliga After Works. På Nexer Strategy i Göteborg kommer du att tillhöra vårt inspirationsfyllda kontor på Lindholmspiren, vid färjeläget, som blivit framröstat som ett av Sveriges snyggaste kontor. 
  Är du vår nya kollega?  Vi söker dig som har: 
 
 Relevant högskoleexamen, gärna teknisk, och erfarenhet inom agila metoder och Business Analysis. 
 Erfarenhet av att verka som brygga mellan verksamhet och IT, kanske i form av förvaltningsledare eller i nulägesanalyser. 
 God förmåga i det kommunikativa och erfaren inom facilitering/ workshopledning, processkartläggning och användning av olika verktyg. 
 Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med att fånga och hantera både funktionella och icke-funktionella krav från verksamheten och user-stories. 
 Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift. 
 Meriterande med erfarenhet från kravställning och kravanalys inom offentlig sektor. 
 Meriterande med erfarenhet från Jira, Azure DevOps, Confluence och SAFe ramverk. 
 
 Vi ser det även som en merit om du har tidigare konsulterfarenhet och certifieringar, tex i IREB eller andra relevanta certifieringar.    Utöver detta är dina personliga egenskaper minst lika viktiga för oss då vi vill behålla den kultur vi har idag. Våra medarbetare kännetecknas av en affärsmässig och kundorienterad attityd, samt förmåga att snabbt ta till sig ny information och omvandla den till kreativa lösningar. Du respekterar dina kollegor och har en stark vilja att dela med dig av dina kunskaper till andra samt lyssna och lära. Inom vår enhet har vi samlat en mängd kompetenser som aktivt lär av varandra och skapar en större helhet. Låter detta intressant för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan till oss på Nexer och Strategy! 
  Ansökan  Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan här nedan. Vi har tyvärr ingen möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post, men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer, hör av dig till Natalie Svensson på natalie.svensson@nexergroup.com. Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med att söka! 
  Nexer som arbetsgivare 
 Jobbar du på Nexer får du en modig och entreprenörsdriven arbetsgivare med internationell närvaro. Vi är stolta över att leda den digitala revolutionen och vara i teknikens framkant, alltid med ett agilt och framåtlutat förhållningssätt. Här får du unika möjligheter att drömma stort, agera smart och utvecklas. Vi är ett familjeägt bolag med långsiktiga strategier, vilket innebär att du är nära de som fattar beslut och kan vara med och påverka. Dessutom erbjuder vi en flexibel arbetspolicy, där det finns möjlighet att arbeta på distans när det passar dig och ditt uppdrag. 
 Vår kultur 
 Vår vision är Promising future – det är viktigt för oss att göra skillnad och bidra till en bättre framtid. Vi har ett engagemang för våra kunder och en uppriktig omtanke om varandra. Vi omfamnar mångfald och tror att människor med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter gör vårt arbete och vårt företag bättre. Vi värdesätter innovation och viljan att utvecklas och ta nästa steg – framåt och uppåt. Dessutom har vi roligt på jobbet!

job_title: Business Analyst for the Automotive sector
job_description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Business & Technology Solutions  (BTS) is a growing practice in Sweden with the aspiration to be the key trusted advisor accompanying our clients on their transformation journey to a more successful, sustainable, and innovative future, bringing in-depth business and technology as well as transformation expertise. By joining BTS, you will have the opportunity to help shape the set-up, form the culture, and together decide on what is important to focus on initially and long term to create a dynamic, fun, and rewarding workplace.     We are looking for experienced  Business Analysts  to join our  Automotive  team, where you work with some of the leading and most well-known brands within this industry driving their digitalization journey. As a Business Analyst you play a leading role in complex client projects at the intersection of business and digital. To support our customers in their digital transformation, Capgemini is looking for consultants with passion for business and technology serving the Automotive sector.      The responsibilities will vary between initiatives, you will:  
 
 Bring experience from working in early stages to prepare and initiate implementation of business opportunities 
 Identify opportunities with existing and new customers, support with your industry know-how and assessment of market trends in the preparation and execution 
 Act as the bridge between business and IT 
 Contribute with domain experience within industrial, commercial (marketing, aftermarket, retail) and finance 
 Be responsible for understanding business requirements and customer needs and translating these to user-stories 
 Be part of an Agile Delivery team and act as an extension of Product Owner 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 What you'll bring:  
 
 Experience working in the automotive domain 
 Experience in Requirements elicitation and analysis 
 Experience with Process Modelling 
 Data Capture and data analytics 
 Detailed understanding of Systems Lifecycles and design 
 Process and platform experience in one or more of the following – Supply Chain Management, Sourcing and Procurement, Sales & Distribution, Manufacturing processes, Connected Services and ecommerce 
 Experience of implementing larger transformation programs 
 Experience with SAP, Microsoft and Salesforce is a plus 
 
 
 
 Soft skills and background:  
 
 You are characterized by your experience/interest in business development and sales, your focus on results, your strategic thinking, your high level of self-motivation and customer orientation. 
 You are a strong communicator who understands the importance of fostering relationships with business and IT stakeholders, you are comfortable working in a mixed client and Capgemini agile environment – and have a good level of Swedish both spoken and written. 
 You are fine with independent work but have experience of and thinks collaboration and teamwork is the ground for a good result. 
 Bachelor's degree in business, management, or a related field. 
  Apply now! For more information, please mail to bts_se_recruitment@capgemini.com.
     
 
 
 
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Let's create the future together. 
 At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us? 
 
 Who We Are 
 Complete HIL performs system- and integration-testing for distributed vehicle and user functions, system performance testing and ADAS scenario testing on complete system level. The test environment consists of the electrical system of the vehicle, including all relevant ECUs, and actuators as well as environment and traffic simulations and sensor data emulations. 
 Testing is performed both manually and automated and the tester need to have a good knowledge in automotive systems as well as SW testing methodology and coding knowledge. 
 For ADAS testing, being able to evaluate the performance of the vehicle and SW and creating traffic simulation scenarios is part of the responsibility. 
 
 What You'll Do 
 As a test engineer your primary responsibility is to create testcases and carry out testing on the product. 
 
 Analyze test need based on requirements test analysis and test description. 
 Creating test specifications based on test description and requirement analysis. 
 Perform manual testing. 
 Perform fault tracing related to domain in collaboration with HIL dev teams and delivering ARTs. 
 Support developing ART in integration testing, correction and fault tracing. 
 Write and follow up fault reports on issues found in the rigs. 
 Write test reports and present test results. 
 Continuously work with improvements on tests, methods and tools. 
 Create and run automated testcases based on test specifications. 
 Maintain testcases and ensure regression tests are always up to date. 
 Actively learning and gaining knowledge within domain and complete HIL. 
 
 What You'll Bring 
 
 BSc in software-, electrical-, mechanical/mechatronic- or automotive engineering or equivalent work life experience. 
 Automotive software testing experience 
 Matlab/Simulink 
 dSpace test rig knowledge 
 Automotive communication protocols. 
 ADAS functions development or testing. 
 
 Meritorious: 
 
 SystemWeaver 
 Canoe/CANalyser 
 ISTQB certified 
 Vehicle knowledge, domain or system 
 Git 
 Robot Framework 
 Jenkins 
 Jira/Vira 
 Volvo product development 
 
 How to learn more and apply  For questions about the position please contact Engineering Manager, Erik Cedergren at erik.andersson.9@volvocars.com or the recruiter Kanika Singhal at kanika.singhal@volvocars.com. 
 
 Volvo Cars - Driving change together 
 Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.

Aurobay has over hundred years of heritage in creating premium quality engines. With homes in Sweden and China, we have a strong reputation for pioneering practices in the automotive industry. We pride ourselves in our attention to detail and commitment to excellence.  This role as a Business Support Analyst offers a dynamic opportunity to work closely with both the Corporate Office team and the Executive Management Team. The Business Support Analyst will support the company by providing key analysis in business cases, product strategy, and investment evaluations. The role involves preparing presentations, conducting ad-hoc analysis, and assisting with management meetings. The ideal candidate will have strong financial and organizational skills to contribute to strategic decision-making and support the company's key initiatives.  What we offer  In addition to a competitive salary, a great location on Lindholmen or Skövde, and a genuine work-life balance, we provide the following benefits:  A yearly wellness contribution of SEK 5 000 for your physical and mental wellbeing.  A personal and professional development scheme to support your growth.  Additional pension funding.  Competitive additional and full coverage insurance.Skills and Experience  A master's degree in business, economics, or engineering.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on data-driven decision-making.  Proficient in basic financial modeling, data analysis, and supporting strategic planning efforts, with a strong willingness to learn and grow.  Collaborative spirit to work with cross-functional teams on strategic initiatives.  Proven experience in creating, organizing, and presenting communication materials effectively.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.   Your role at Aurobay    As a Business Support Analystyou will:  Provide ad-hoc business support, analysis, and research.  Assist in the creation and structuring of business cases, including research, data collection, and analysis.  Perform financial analysis and modeling to evaluate the potential impact of proposed projects and initiatives.  Coordinate with project managers, finance, and other departments to ensure timely completion of business case deliverables.  Develop material and presentations for the company, both forinternal and external use.   Equal opportunities employer  We are an equal opportunities employer. We encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply, especially women, people from ethnic minority backgrounds, and people with disabilities. Research has shown that women and people from ethnic minority backgrounds are less likely to apply if they don't match 100% of the criteria. As a company, we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. If you believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Let's explore the possibilities together.  How to apply  Deadline to submit your application is September30 but the selection process will be running continuously. Please note that due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email. We can’t wait to see what you can bring to our team!  Questions  If you have any additional questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Martin Svegander, martin.svegander@aurobay.com  For questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter Louise Mårdholm, louise.mardholm@aurobay.com    Questions concerning trade union:   Unionen:  Ordf Joakim Dahlin, joakim.dahlin@aurobay.com  Ledarna:  Ordf Håkan Modigh, hakan.modigh@aurobay.com  Akademikerna:  Ordf. Fredrik Fantenberg, fredrik.fantenberg@aurobay.com  IF Metall:  Ordf Marko Borg Peltonen, marko.borg.peltonen@aurobay.com

job_title: Senior Solution Architect - Order and distribution
job_description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match. 
 
 
 
  The Position 
 
 
 As Solution Architect, you will take on the responsibility to details the solution based on business need. We want you to drive our digital agenda of our cloud ERP environment and future technologies like IoT. You should be able to convert the epic to business feature. 
 
  You manage IT integration solutions using relevant platforms, support services, methods, and guidelines.
