job_title: Digital Strategy Product Data Analyst to H&M Sales (Parental Cover) – Digital Experience & Commercial Unit
job_description:
Company Description 
  **This is an 11 months contract** 
 H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day. 
 We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong. 
 Be yourself & more at H&M.  Job Description 
 
  The Digital Strategy Analytics Team supports the Value Streams and Commercial Teams within the Digital Unit with actionable insights and data-driven strategic options. This role will support our global digital product teams in improving our shoppers’ journeys and growing their analytics prowess by steering data-driven roadmaps and commercial initiatives. The role interacts with a vast number of stakeholders (regional teams, central BI teams, commercial leaders, expansion teams, product teams) to coordinate the totality of conversations and competencies around our digital business performance.  Some of your main responsibilities & tasks will include: 
 Coordinate analytical projects across Digital Value Streams (for example, Pay, Receive & Return or Inspire & Discover), leading the process of hypothesis formulation - analysis - conclusion – recommendations 
 With high customer centricity, empower stakeholders to improve the customer experience through expert analysis of behavioral, commercial and product performance data 
 Help steer product roadmaps by supporting Product Managers and Value Stream Managers to prioritize resource allocation and product / value stream backlogs 
 Build and take ownership of business cases owned by the value streams, bringing together commercial, digital, user behavior understanding 
 Help commercial stakeholders understand the performance of products and features owned by your value stream peers 
 Work with multiple advanced analytics tools to analyze, execute and follow up initiatives from idea to industrialization 
 Be the driver for data driven decision making by enabling data visibility and educating the different stakeholders 
 Convert different forms of data into common language in order to guide commercial and regional teams 
 Use SQL, Google BigQuery, Google Looker, PowerBI and other analytical tools to dive deep into the data lake 
 Participate in the wider analytics community, both within CX&S and the wider H&M group 
    Qualifications 
  Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a sales-minded, social, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability with an eye for change and improvement opportunities. 
 
 3+ years of experience from product or business analysis, customer or commercial analytics, management consulting 
 Very strong experience with SQL 
 Previous experience with cloud analytics environments such as Databricks or GCP 
 Previous experience within ecommerce, retail, fashion or tech product driven companies 
 Academic degree within Business Administration, Economics, Engineering (or similar) 
 Experience in working with data visualization tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, etc 
 Demonstrated ability to synthesize large amounts of data into clear insights 
 Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across different competences (Commercial Leads, eCommerce Managers, Product Managers, Developers, Designers, Data Engineers, etc.) 
 Be comfortable with working within a large matrix organization 
 Strong communication skills and an ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders 
 Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills 
 Fluent in English (written and spoken) 
    Additional Information 
  H&M Group is a value-driven company that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. 
 Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. 
 The role is based in Stockholm. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English. We will review and interview applicants continuously. 
  Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. 
 We look forward to receiving your application! 
  H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.

Adding Insight är en specialistbyrå inom digital analys grundat 2015. Under åren har vi haft förmånen att få arbeta tätt med kunder som IKEA, Dustin, Axfood, SBAB och Epidemic Sound. Vi är för närvarande fyra konsulter och önskar att växa med ytterligare en till två seniora roller.  Vår affärskultur präglas av schyssta värderingar och kundsamarbeten av högsta kvalité. Vi har ett kontor i centrala Stockholm men som situationen ser ut idag så arbetar vi främst hemifrån. 
  Om rollen 
 Vi söker dig som är specialiserad inom digital analys och är lika nyfiken som oss på hur man kan använda nya verktyg, teknologier eller processer för att skapa insikter och handlingskraftiga beslutsunderlag. 
 Som konsult arbetar du nära våra kunders marknads- och analysteam, oftast som en resurs i kundernas team. 
 Du kommer att stötta kunderna i förståelse av hur deras webbplatser eller appar används samt utvärderar och ger förslag på optimering av deras digitala marknadsföring. 
 Varierande arbetsuppgifter förekommer och inkluderar allt från att ta fram mätplaner, säkerställa en hög datakvalitet till att vara med och förbättra webbplatser och appar. 
 Du kommer främst att arbeta med verktygen Google Analytics, Microsoft Excel, Google Data Studio, Google Tag Manager, Google Optimize och Google BigQuery. 
 I rollen kommer du att arbeta med mellanstora och stora företagskunder i Norden. Vi främjar kundsamarbeten med fokus på jämställdhet och en klimat-positiv framtid. 
  Om dig 
 
 Du har arbetat med liknande uppgifter i minst tre år. 
 Har ett självständigt arbetssätt och arbetar effektivt tillsammans i team. 
 En akademisk bakgrund. 
 Meriterande med erfarenhet av Google Cloud, Javascript och BI-verktyg. 
 Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult är också meriterande. 
 
  Vårt erbjudande 
 
 Konkurrenskraftig lön. 
 Optionsprogram. 
 Flexibla arbetstider och distansarbete. 
 Friskvård 5000 kr per år. 
 Trygghet och sjukvårdsförsäkring. 
 En schysst, prestigelös och entreprenöriell arbetsmiljö. 
 Möjlighet till personlig utveckling inom bland annat ledarskap och presentationsteknik. 
 
  Nästa steg 
 Ansök direkt eller maila daniel@addinginsight.se om du har frågor!

Vi letar efter en erfaren Data Analyst till vårt växande Analytics team. Vi söker dig som kan driva analysarbetet framåt, är nyfiken på ny teknik och analytiska tillämpningar. Du gillar att samarbeta med kollegor och kunder för att omvandla affärsfrågeställningar baserat på data, analyser och insikter för att skapa affärsvärde. 
 Vad vi kan erbjuda: 
 
 Möjligheten att jobba tillsammans med duktiga kollegor. 
 Ständig utveckling inom data och analysområdet. 
 Leda kunder i deras resa till att bli datadrivna. 
 En platt organisation som genomsyras av teamwork. 
 En internationell och öppen företagskultur. 
 
 Vad vi letar efter: 
 
 Universitetsutbildning i Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics eller liknande områden. 
 3+ års erfarenhet av att jobba som Data Analyst. 
 Förmåga att analysera trender, kundbeteende och affärspotential baserat på intern och extern data. 
 En problemlösare som har erfarenhet av deskriptiv och diagnostisk analys. Förståelse för hypotesprövning och prediktiva analysmetoder. 
 Djup dataförståelse inom databaser och SQL och programmeringskompetens inom Python, SAS eller R. 
 Arbetat med rapport- och visualiseringsverktyg (Ex Tableau, Power BI, Excel) för att dra slutsatser och visualisera resultat (grafer, diagram och histogram). 
 
 Vem är  Adage : 
 Adage är inte bara ännu ett konsultföretag – vi är specialister helt fokuserade på att förbättra företag med Data & Analytics. Vi bryr oss om resultatet, inte om någon hype. 
  På Adage är vi bra på det vi gör, vi har ett recept för framgång och vi är ärliga i vårt samarbete med kunden. Vi håller det enkelt. Här blir du en del av en varm och rolig familj, med en ovanligt hög ambition.

City: Solna
     
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     Job Function: Other
     
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Do you want to take SAS customer analytics to the next level? 
 
 
 Welcome to SAS and the customer analytics team! We are a part of SAS Commercial and responsible for analyzing marketing and customer data to better understand and predict our customers’ needs and behavior. As a customer analyst, you will be part of SAS’s analytics team where you play an important role in our ambition to create a world-class customer experience. 
 
 
 
 
 Main responsibilities: 
 
 
 As a Customer Analyst, you will be part of a cross-functional team who is responsible for SAS Marketing and CRM communication. You will provide analysis of customer behaviors, insights and knowledge of customers’ response and predict future actions. 
 
   Key responsibilities and tasks: 
 
 Evaluate marketing campaigns and CRM communication to give insights and recommendations on how to maximize the effect of those. 
 Perform analysis and create basis for decisions on e.g. creation of new automated campaigns and personalization measures. 
 Help optimize and personalize customer communication in omni-channel to maximize customer experience. 
 Have a decent understanding of Data Warehouse and ETL concepts in order to assist in the modeling of analytical tables and views. 
 Define and set up customer segmentation. 
 Create scripts and jobs in our data warehouse to gather data needed for target groups and perform analysis. 
 Evaluate, test, build and maintain scoring models and target groups to maximize customer experience and the effect of marketing initiatives. 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications and requirements 
 
 Master’s degree in relevant field such as Business administration, Computer Science or Statistics. 
 Strong SQL skills. 
 Experience working with CRM and/or Data Analytics. 
 Experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud will be considered a big plus. 
 Experience from working with analysis in a digital media context (e.g. with Google Analytics/BigQuery or similar platform). 
 Knowledge in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau). 
 
 
 
 As a person we believe that you have the ability to see the big picture, while you are accurate and can secure details. You are result-oriented, dedicated, reliable in delivery and have an ability to independently run and lead projects. Furthermore, you have very good analytical skills, are interested in handling large amounts of data and have the ability to see patterns and draw conclusions that support the commercials. 
 
 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply at latest September 22nd 2024 with your CV and a short personal letter. 
 
 Working at SAS  Benefits of working with us in SAS include attractive travel possibilities, free gym access and a good pension scheme. We offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international fast-paced working environment. SAS is dedicated to the continuous development of its employees. Frösundavik is a great place to work. There is a gym, restaurant, café, and a variety of services to make your life easier. It’s located in a green area of Solna and close to Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. There’s a non-stop bus connection from the Central Station to Frösunda, commuter trains to/from Solna Station, and a good network of cycle paths. 
 #LI-VK1 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 SAS, Scandinavia's leading airline since 1946, operates from its principal hub at Copenhagen Airport (CPH), complemented by hubs in Oslo (OSL) and Stockholm (ARN). Our mission is to connect Scandinavia with the world and the world with Scandinavia. Each year, SAS serves more than 25 million passengers and transports 55 tons of cargo to 135 destinations across Europe, the USA, and Asia. With a passionate workforce of over 10,000 colleagues, we collaborate with partners and customers to drive transformative changes in aviation. We are committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, embodying the visionary spirit of our founders: “To move from the old to what is about to come, is the only tradition worth keeping”. Innovation and societal progress are at the heart of everything we do. For

Är du en nyfiken person med god social förmåga och ett driv att lära dig nytt samt vara med och förändra samt effektivisera verksamheten med hjälp av BI/Analytics?  Då har du hittat rätt! 
 Vi är en relativt ny enhet inom CoreChange som söker fler kollegor som vill vara med på en spännande resa framåt med innovation och tillväxt i fokus. Våra kunder behöver stöd i sina möjligheter att bli än mer effektiva och det genom digitalisering och effektivisering. Med hjälp av Data Analytics-lösningar kan de dels få rätt underlag för sina beslut men också se potentiella möjligheter och utfall. Steget vidare är att få det automatiserat, dynamiskt vilket vi ser till att lösa. Enkelhet är något vi förespråkar och vårt mål är alltid att hjälpa våra kunder att få en enklare vardag.  Visst låter det kul? 
 Vi söker medarbetare som är drivna, affärsmässiga, lösningsorienterade och pragmatiska. Du som har kunskap inom något av våra erbjudanden samt trivs i entreprenöriella arbetsmiljöer där nya idéer och initiativtagande uppmuntras. Vi ser gärna att du kommer från ett etablerat konsultbolag med minst 4 års erfarenhet. 
  Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet inom något/ några av följande områden, plattformar och verktyg: 
 
 Data Arkitekt 
 Data Engineer 
 Data Analyst 
 Business Analyst 
 Projektledning inom BI & analytics 
 Datamodellering 
 SQL programmering 
 Andra språk som Python & Java är ett plus 
 Erfarenhet av både analys och rapportverktyg så som Power BI, Tableau eller Business Objects 
 Erfarenhet av olika integrationsverktyg/ETL-verktyg samt olika databaser exempelvis SSIS, Databricks, Synapse, DBT eller Matillion 
 Gärna arbetat med molnlösningar så som Azure & Snowflake 
 Gärna erfarenhet av Machine Learning, AI, Data Lakes 
 
  Vad erbjuder vi mer då?  Personlig utveckling är viktigt för oss och därför matchar vi projekt efter person för att se till att kurvan går uppåt - man blir aldrig fullärd. Vill du utvecklas mer är vi där och stöttar. Du blir en del i företagskulturen där vi alltid supporterar, utvecklar och tror på varandra. CoreChange värdesätter en bra och öppen kultur och vi vet vad som krävs för att trivas på jobbet!    Vi är på en resa där alla får vara med och bidra - tankar och idéer är alltid välkomna och tillsammans skapar vi ett ännu bättre CoreChange där du  blir en del av CoreChange-laget!

Job Description 
 At Circle K, our vision is to become the World’s preferred B2B Mobility partner, and we strive every day to make our customers' lives a bit easier. To achieve our vision, we continue to invest in our people and tools that will deliver an improved sales and service experience for our customers, enabling our continued growth across European and North American markets. 
 
  (Senior) Global Sales Performance Analyst 
 
  Type of Employment:  Permanent 
  Location:  Stockholm, Sweden, Copenhagen, Denmark or Riga, Latvia 
  Visa requirements:  A valid work permit from the EU/EEA (relocation assistance is not provided) 
 
 We are seeking a (Senior) Global Sales Performance Analyst to take responsibility for our B2B sales performance reporting, optimization, and business intelligence (BI) solution management, working as part of our Global B2B Sales Excellence team. If you are passionate about data reporting, generating valuable business insights, understanding data flows, and driving sales excellence in one of Europe’s largest fuel and convenience retailers, we want to hear from you. Based on the right experience and background, we will offer seniority in the position. 
 
  THE ROLE 
 You will play an important role in driving B2B sales analysis, reporting insights, and corrective actions to support various commercial and sales performance improvement initiatives within European and North American B2B business. The role will benchmark commercial performance and operations across business units and sales teams, identifying root causes for high/low results to leverage learning across business units. You will also support BI solutions by analyzing the impacts of different business intelligence tools and data flow strategies, ensuring that the right systems and solutions are in place to enhance decision-making. 
 Additionally, the role involves managing change effectively, as new IT systems or business intelligence solutions are implemented. Understanding how different BI solutions impact data flows and organizational processes will be key to recommending and executing the right technologies to meet business goals. 
 
  WHAT YOU'LL DO 
 
 Convert big data into clear and actionable insights – including monthly, weekly, and ad-hoc reporting. 
 Support relevant reporting frameworks to enhance commercial initiatives and process improvements. 
 Suggest operational improvements to sales pipeline management and customer value optimization practices based on KPIs, analysis, and benchmarking. 
 Benchmark sales and commercial performance across business units, identifying value drivers to leverage learnings across regions. 
 Lead decision-making in resource planning and allocation through data modeling and analysis. 
 Collaborate with the IT and business teams to evaluate, implement, and optimize business intelligence tools that enhance reporting and sales pipeline management. 
 Understand and manage data flow, ensuring seamless integration of business intelligence solutions across platforms. 
 Participate in the change management process as BI solutions and other IT systems are implemented, ensuring minimal disruption and maximized benefits. 
 
 
  WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR 
 
 BSc or MSc in a relevant degree (Finance, Business Administration, Economics, IT, Sales, or Marketing). 
 Strong understanding of data flows, BI tools, and their organizational impacts, ideally with a background in IT project management or business analysis. 
 Proven experience in managing or implementing business intelligence solutions, with tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar. 
 Knowledge and/or experience in B2B sales processes and CRM systems like Salesforce. 
 Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills with a strong ability to translate data into actionable insights and recommendations. 
 Excellent collaboration and communication skills – the ability to convey complex information in a simple, actionable format for diverse stakeholders. 
 Change management, IT project management, or business analysis skills are considered an advantage. 
 
 
  Team and Collaboration: 
 You will be a part of a team of 15 talented colleagues in three different departments, each with different responsibilities but working in close collaboration. The team meets up in person at least on quarterly basis, allowing you to stay connected and align on key initiatives. You will also have the opportunity to work hybrid, with flexibility to work from home. 
 
  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT AT CIRCLE K 
 Our office employment opportunities offer you career growth with an international company, plus a dynamic work environment that puts people first. Wherever you are in your journey, we have a place for you. Here’s some of the exciting perks we offer: 
 
  Alimentation Couche-Tard  is a proud receiver Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award (GEWA) for 3 years in a row. 
 Complete benefits packages (health insurance, pension contribution etc.). 
 Possibility to enroll in stock purchase plan. 
 Employee discount on fuel and in our stores. 
 Paid time off plan including vacation, sick days and personal days. 
 Work in a collaborative, dynamic, high performing and diverse team. 
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and to evolve professionally in a fast-growing company. 
 Hybrid work to allow a sustainable work-life balance. 
 
 
 At Circle K, our culture is shaped by our team members and how we treat each other. Our guiding principles are the core values we live by and inform all our actions and business decisions. You can find them at Values and Culture | Circle K. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview. 
 
  INTERESTED?  
 We   encourage you to apply by  October1st, 2024.  
 Applications are considered on a rolling basis. However, please be aware that we may update or close this position at any time, even before the listed closing date. Therefore, if you’re interested, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible. 
 
 You don't meet all the necessary qualifications? At Circle K, we are fully committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine work environment. Therefore, if you're enthusiastic about this role but your background doesn't perfectly match every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. 
 
 Contact person: 
  Martin Hansen 
  Senior Manager Global Commercial Excellence and Performance Management 
 e: Martin.Hansen3@circlekeurope.com 
 
 Only applications received through our online system will be considered. 
 
  We are looking forward to your application!

Who is Infinitas Learning? 
 For everyone who discovers. For everyone who grows. For everyone who performs and challenges themselves. For your smallest dreams and your biggest ambitions. Learning will take you further. From your first day at school to the next step in your career. Infinitas Learning is there for you and everyone who learns. 
 We at Infinitas Learning are passionate about understanding and transforming the way people learn. We create educational solutions that touch the lives of everyone around us - both personally and professionally. 
 The Infinitas Learning group includes Liber (Sweden), Noordhoff (The Netherlands), Plantyn (Belgium) and Leya (Portugal) as well as Infinitas Product & Technology (The Netherlands). The group employs around 600 people and is headquartered in Utrecht (The Netherlands). 
 The role 
 Are you an analytical talent with a passion for data and affinity with business processes? 
 As a Data Analyst at Infinitas Learning, you will be part of a centralized Data & Insights team. Our role as the central team is to identify business problems worth solving, that need solving, and tackle them by utilizing, combining, and analyzing existing source data from systems such as Netsuite and Salesforce. This enables the business and customers to make better (data-driven) decisions more quickly and with greater confidence. We operate across a broad variety of domains such as finance, operations, commercial, learning didactics, and platform usage. 
 For this specific role we are looking for an analyst in the business operations domain. You will focus on turning commercial and/or operational data into valuable insights and reports for different stakeholders within Infinitas. Focus is on reports like email dashboards, commercial reports, and/or product specifications insights and stock overviews. With your expertise in data and business you will manage various initiatives, ensuring the delivery of project milestones within the agreed timeframe and quality standards. You will work together with business stakeholders on (further) forming the data driven way of working within the domain. You will have a great opportunity to shape the landscape. 
  What you will do 
 
 Design, build, and deliver accurate and fast analytical reporting and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI fed from the data marts. 
 Work closely with various stakeholders within the business operations domain to identify areas where Data & Insights can be used to improve business processes and operation. You are excellent at linking data with business goals. 
 Utilize a strong business acumen to identify and develop analytical use-cases with high value together with various stakeholders. 
 Ensure optimal performance to maximize the use of the Power BI functionality. Excel in designing data models to best practices including use of complex DAX-calculations, making use of conformed dimensions and striving to push business logic to the data marts. Work in close cooperation with Analytical Engineers to give feedback regarding necessary design changes on data models and missing data. 
 Communicate, document, and present the use of our analytical tools to peers and different stakeholders throughout the organization. 
 Constantly stay up to date on new technologies in the analytical reporting, dashboards, and visualization space and where they may fit our initiatives. 
 
 
  Who you are 
 
 Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment handling multiple activities simultaneously. Exercise business judgment and make sound decisions under pressure. 
 Take initiative, are transparent, and deliver high-quality results. We take it for granted that you are responsible, and solutions oriented. 
 An analytical, innovative, and structured problem solver with a passion to make data analysis a business asset by enabling value. 
 One of your core competences is understanding the strategic goals and purpose of an organization and align data initiatives accordingly. 
 Recognize the importance of working as one team and can identify and develop talent. You thrive when developing people, not just products. Giving and receiving feedback is a natural part of your everyday work. 
 Appreciate working with international colleagues and distributed teams. 
 A curious and life-long learner with a keen interest in the evolution of analytical reporting and visualization techniques. 
 
  What experience you must have to qualify as a candidate 
 We understand that each person has a unique set of skills and that finding a candidate with a 100% fit would filter out some amazing people, so take this list as a guide and don't hesitate to apply if you don't tick all of them. 
 You would be a good fit if you: 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in either Data Analytics, Marketing Intelligence, Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science or relevant field with a strong business related component from an accredited college or university. 
 2 years of experience in data analytics is preferred: maintenance and support of analytical reports and dashboards. 
 Designed, developed, tested, and supported analytical reporting and dashboards using technologies such as Tableau, Qlik, or Power BI. Experience programming in complex DAX calculations, Python, or R is preferred. 
 Being certified for Power BI (PL-300) is a plus. 
 Having consultancy experience is a plus. 
 Excellent English written and oral communication skills. 
 Fluent in Dutch or Swedish is preferred. 
 Working permit within the European Union. 
 Can work regularly at one of our office locations Antwerpen/Stockholm/Utrecht/Groningen 
 
  What Infinitas Learning offers you 
 
 Competitive salary. 
 Attractive and flexible employment conditions. 
 Flexible working hours depending on team requirements as to how, where, and when you work. 
 A job with a real purpose where you really contribute to society. 
 
 Applications are being reviewed on an ongoing basis. In case of any questions please feel free to reach out to Sander Beckers, Team Lead Data & Insights, sbeckers@infinitaslearning.com please apply via https://careers.infinitaslearning.com. Applications via LinkedIn, direct messages, or mail will not be reviewed.

Job Description Summary  We are looking for a Business Analyst for our Medication Delivery Solutions business unit based in Denmark, Norway, Finland, or Sweden, with a preference for someone located in Stockholm. In this role, you will support commercial teams, Business Unit Managers, and the Country Business Leader by providing key insights and analysis to drive informed decision-making. You will be crucial in helping the organisation meet its financial goals and strategic objectives. This role offers hybrid working with a home office option, ensuring a good work-life balance.    OUR VISION FOR MDS AT BD  As a leading manufacturer and supplier of products that are used daily in healthcare, the Medication Delivery Solutions (MDS) team provide a wide range of products for injection and infusion therapy, regional anaesthesia and closed medication management.
  
  Job Description 
  We are the makers of possible 
 BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities. 
  Why join us? 
 A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time. 
 To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place. 
 Become a  maker of possible  with us! 
  Main responsibilities will include: 
 
 Perform comprehensive analyses to guide decision-making, manage risks, and find opportunities. 
 Lead the forecasting and budgeting processes, ensuring accurate and timely completion in line with European business unit standards. 
 Mentor a junior business analyst, supporting their development and growth within the team. 
 Provide support and workshops to sales teams by addressing system-related questions. 
 Offer financial insights to assist with planning and setting business objectives. 
 Prepare financial reports and presentations for monthly business reviews with BU leadership and European counterparts. 
 Develop and maintain monthly reports and analytical tools to meet the business unit's information requirements. 
 Utilise tools such as Excel, Power BI, and Salesforce to enhance data-driven decision-making processes. 
 
  About you: 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Finance or a related field. 
 Proven experience as a business analyst, with a strong focus on financial analysis and data interpretation. 
 Fluent in English and one Nordic language. 
 Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and Salesforce. 
 Experience in healthcare or the medical device industry, especially in tender management within a large international organisation, is a plus. 
 Strong analytical skills, adaptable to dynamic environments, and able to work both independently and collaboratively. 
 Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a willingness to mentor and assist colleagues with IT tool-related queries, particularly regarding Excel. 
 
  Click on apply if this sounds like you! 
 
 Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, military eligibility or veteran status, or any other protected status. 
  To learn more about BD visit:  https://bd.com/careers 
 
  Primary Work Location  SWE Stockholm - Marieviksgatan
  
  Additional Locations  DNK Herlev – Lyskær, FIN Vantaa – Äyritie, NOR Oslo
  
  Work Shift  SE 20 (Sweden)

Are you our new Business Intelligence Analyst who will enable smooth and fact-based claims operations?
  
 
 
  As our Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have a key role in ensuring that when bad luck strikes, our customers’ lives get back to normal as quickly and smoothly as possible. We are continuously improving our services and as BI Analyst you will contribute to value creation and ensure we stay ahead by supporting in transforming analysis into actionable insights.
  
 
 
  About the role
  
 
  Claims is a crucial part of If from a financial, people and customer perspective. In Claims we have appr. 1.800 committed claims professionals caring for our customers and taking care of 2 million customer claims per year.
  
 
  You will be a part of Nordic Claims Business Intelligence & Reporting Chapter in Claims Controlling and Business Development, reporting to Chapter Lead for BI & Reporting. The main area of responsibility for Chapter is to secure world-class business performance follow-up and through data analyses provide business insights to support decision making demands. To support you, we have established close co-operation between Controlling, Business Development, Data Management and Analytics communities. As our BI Analyst, you have mandate to release the power of If’s many data assets to raise automation, optimize digital experiences, improve operational efficiency, and increase customer satisfaction.
  
 
  In this position you will have a unique opportunity to collaborate and network throughout our organisation as well as monitor, analyze, visualize, and communicate fact-based intelligence of our operations. You have a key role in drawing conclusions from data and helping business stakeholders translate these into decisions and actions.
  
 
  Your responsibility will also be
  
 
 Support and challenge the organization on performance and value creation 
 Contributing to our operational reporting and analysis of results 
 Maintaining and developing our current reports 
 Contributing to the development of a Nordic Datawarehouse by giving input on content and promoting its use in your own and others’ work 
 Being a role model, contributing to our professional way of working and knowledge sharing 
 
 
 
  We offer
  
 
  In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
  
 
 An including work environment where everyone is welcome 
 Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics 
 Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment 
 Possibility of hybrid work 
 Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities 
 Great insurance benefits 
 Lunch benefit 
 High pension savings 
 
 
 
  About the team
  
 
  With us, you get the opportunity to become part of a team where everyone walks that extra mile – both for our customers and our colleagues. In an organization built on trust and stability we have the possibility to truly put our hearts into our job. As member of our Nordic team, we expect you to be actively involved in development of Claims reporting and operations. We believe in a Nordic strategy that utilizes best practice across the countries to continue improving performance and customer experience. As a member of the team, you are also integral in creating an inclusive culture where people feel safe bringing their full selves to work and leverage diversity. And last, but not least; we welcome you to an informal working environment with lots of smiles and a positive attitude, as we have fun along the work.
  
 
 
  Who are you?
  
 
  You are a team player and have strong ability to suggest new ways in which analytics can improve our operations and services for customer and company alike. Based on your experience and analytical skills you have an instinct for what kind of analytics is best suited to address a business problem. You have excellent communication skills enabling you to work pro-actively and efficiently in different settings. A high sense of responsibility defines you, and you can be trusted to deliver. You enjoy both understanding the big picture but also working with details. You are passionate about striving for improvements. You have curios mind with a proactive attitude, and you challenge yourself to grow.
  
 
 
  You also have:
  
 
 Excellent analytical, data processing, and problem-solving skills 
 Excellent skills & experience in using BI tools such as Tableau or Microsoft Power BI 
 Experience of data transformation and programming (e.g. SQL). 
 Self-motivation and ability to work in a delivery-oriented environment 
 Agile mindset 
 Fluency in English and one of the Nordic Languages 
 Relevant academic/university degree 
 Knowledge of insurance business and digital development in the financial industry and experience with Microsoft Azure is considered a bonus 
 
 
 
  Additional facts and recruitment process:
  
 
  Application deadline: Last day of application is the 22nd of September.
  
 
  To apply for the position: : Please attach your CV. You don’t need to write a cover letter, instead we would like you to answer a few questions. The questionnaire will automatically pop up when you are applying
  
 
 
  Work location: Sweden, Mölndal
  
 
 Some travelling in the Nordic countries is required 
 As soon as possible/by agreement. 
 
 
 
  For more information, please contact Chapter Lead for Claims BI & Reporting Jonna-Mari Kivijakola, phone: +35 850 42 41 809
  
 
 
  We look forward to your application

Techster Solutions  befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst  1+  års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet. 
  Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa. 
  Rollbeskrivning: 
  Assignment Description 
 Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking an IT Business Analyst – Customs for an onsite position at their Gothenburg office. This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated professional to contribute to key business and technology initiatives within a dynamic, global organization. 
  Qualifications: 
 
 Several years of experience in a similar position as an IT Business Analyst, with a proven track record in the industry. 
 Strong domain knowledge in supply chain and logistics (experience in customs is a plus). 
 Experience within the automotive industry is beneficial. 
 Proficiency in data modeling, preferably using Power BI. 
 Familiarity with analyzing commonly used file formats such as XML, JSON, YAML, etc. 
 Experience with PDM/BOM structures is an advantage. 
 Skilled in interviewing key stakeholders and facilitating workshops to identify business needs and model processes/information. 
 Proven ability to lead investigations and projects from start to finish. 
 
  Desired Attributes: 
 
 Excellent analytical and documentation skills to effectively capture and communicate insights. 
 Strong ability to navigate and understand complex digital ecosystems with multiple integrations. 
 A clear understanding of dependencies and interfaces between processes and solutions. 
 A good understanding of Agile development methodologies. 
 Experience in creating features, user stories, and acceptance criteria/scenarios to guide development teams. 
 
 
  Ansökan  Tror du att du är  Techster Solutions  nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. 
  Arbetsplats och kultur 
 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt. 
 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match. 
 
  Electromobility is changing the automotive world, and we are now looking for you who want to be part of this change happening in our industry! The Electromobility organization is responsible for the complete development lifecycle of our electric powertrains – from advanced engineering through product development into the maintenance phase. Together we drive the transition from conventional powertrains to electromobility based on cutting-edge engineering, state-of-the-art research, and well-proven technology within the Volvo Group. By joining us, you’ll be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other, and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win. 
 
  We at Volvo Group are constantly moving and changing to be one step ahead in the technology journey. Within Volvo Group Trucks Technology, we are adapting and challenging ourselves to be able to develop new breakthrough transport solutions. We strive to add value and the best solutions to our customers while being energy efficient, sustainable, and safer for society. That’s the reason we are looking for an experienced data analyst with a passion for Analytics and Data Science. 
 
  We also believe you are a curious person and want to go from idea to practice. You will be involved in developing our products by discovering the information hidden in vast amounts of data from primarily our electrical vehicles. 
  Role Summary: 
  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting Electromobility product development and evolution. By leveraging historical data and prediction models, you will communicate valuable insights. Your core responsibilities will include ensuring data collection and quality, contributing to the establishment of a robust data infrastructure, data visualization, statistical analysis, collecting and cleaning data, processing large datasets, descriptive analytics, and diagnostic analytics.     Key Responsibilities: 
 
 
  Move beyond compiling data to help tell the story behind the numbers by combining the right visuals and narrative with relevant data to stimulate new perspectives and drive change. 
 Use reporting and visualization to create answers to questions we haven't yet asked, demonstrating a passion for uncovering connections that may not be immediately clear to others. 
 Serve as a data advocate, eager to learn and share best practices across the Volvo Group. 
 Enrich the existing landscape of data sources by identifying critical information needs and connecting them into our models through cross-functional partnership and collaboration. 
 Work with high-resolution data from test- and customer vehicles to understand usage and support engineers with product development. 
 Collaborate and network with stakeholders within and outside Volvo. 
 Identify and integrate existing and new data by working closely with the engineering team and various stakeholders to improve product and service capabilities. 
 
 
 
  Technical Requirements: 
 
 
  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related fields. 
 Minimum 3 years of experience working in data analytics, particularly as a data analyst/scientist within the Automotive Industry. 
 Experience in driving and implementing Analytics/Data Science insights, preferably in a global environment. 
 Proficient with relevant technical tools, platforms, and systems such as Python, GitHub, Cloud Analytics, SQL, Data Bricks, KNIME, Power BI, etc. 
 Experience working with Spark and high-resolution time series data. 
 Knowledge of data communication, telematics, and truck services is a bonus. 
 Understanding of internal Volvo data flow is a bonus. 
 Experience in analytics from the service and aftermarket business in the transport industry is a bonus. 
 
 
  If you are passionate about promoting collaboration and understanding in the workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive and supportive environment, we would love to hear from you!  We look forward to recieve your application!     Last application date : 15 October, 2024 
  Curious and want to know more about the role? Please feel free to reach out me! 
  Sina Ghaedian, Group Manager - Data Analytics team at Electromobility  E-mail Adress: sina.ghaedian@volvo.com, 
 
  We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail. 
 
  Who we are and what we believe in  Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide. 
 
  Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join  Volvo Group . Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities. 
 
  Group Trucks Technology  are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

job_title: Data Analyst inom Sustainability på TechSeed
job_description:
På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena. 
 TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu en Data Analyst inom Sustainability som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och skapa en organisation som ska ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans. 
 Som Data Analyst inom Sustainability på TechSeed får du möjlighet att kombinera teknisk kompetens med ett engagemang för miljön. I denna roll kommer du i konsultuppdrag samarbeta direkt med våra kunder för att strukturera, samla in och analysera kritiska hållbarhetsdata. Du kommer använda avancerade analytiska verktyg och tekniker för att tolka data och presentera insikter som är både begripliga och handlingsbara. 
 Som en del av TechSeed Data Insights kommer du att bidra till att företag kan fatta välgrundade beslut genom att dra nytta av insikter från AI, maskininlärning, IoT och traditionell Business Intelligence .  Hos Data Insights hittar du engagerade och kunniga kollegor med kompetens inom data strategi, arkitektur, data engineering, AI/ML och rapportering. Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen. 
 
 Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig: 
 
 Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans 
 En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer 
 Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap 
 Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål 
 Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov. 
 
 Vem söker vi? 
 Vi söker dig med expertis inom rapportering! Vi söker dig som är nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och drivs av att arbete med en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget  tillsammans . För att trivas behöver du vara bekväm i rollen som Data Analyst inom Sustainability och ha minst fem års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet. Du har omfattande erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora och komplexa datamängder och är van vid att effektivt extrahera, analysera och presentera insikter. 
 Vi ser även att du har vana av att arbeta i något finansiellt rapporteringssystem, såsom SAP, Oracle Netsuite eller liknande, och har praktisk erfarenhet av att integrera olika datakällor genom API:er och hantera databaser. Vidare är du lösningsorienterad, kommunikativ och trivs i samarbete med andra. För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du har kunskap inom hållbarhetsrapportering där du är uppdaterad inom direktiv som ESG, CSRD och dylikt. Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov krävs det för rollen att vara obehindrad i både svenska och engelska, tal och skrift. 
 Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att jobba på ett start/scale-up, att ha tidigare konsulterfarenhet, vana av att arbeta med något BI-verktyg eller att tidigare ha arbetat inom hållbarhetsrapportering i enlighet med NFRD. 
 Om TechSeed 
 Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

JAS is an international, non-asset-based supply chain services and solutions company. Our services include air and ocean freight forwarding, contract logistics, customs brokerage, distribution, inbound logistics, truckload brokerage and other supply chain management services, including consulting, the coordination of purchase orders and customized management services.
  
  The Business Process Support Specialist supports the BPM team in all aspects of:   
 
 Trainings / Training Contents development & maintenance 
 
 
 Business Intelligence analytics and development to support continuous operations process improvement. 
 
 
 Global Operations Business Process Subject Matter Expert, Support, and Auditing. 
  The position requires a pro-active, self-motivated and process oriented individual with excellent analytical and communication skills. These traits are critical for this position to successfully improve and maintain compliance to the global standard processes and procedures, as well as subsidiary performance, on a global scale. Additional responsibilities include process improvement, testing, training and support.    The ability to challenge the status quo and to work across organizational silos, logical thinking, excellent communication skills, a professional demeanor and strong contribution in a team environment are required for this position. The Business Process Support Specialist must be able to effectively manage multiple tasks simultaneously, and to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
  
 
  PRIMARY FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  
 
 Create global operations training contents, maintain JAS University operations process contents 
 Create and provide business analytics on global Operation KPIs and Job Management performance. 
 Prepare business requirements to support development of business process improvement 
 Prepare reports and analyze Operation KPIs Performance (KPI) to provide suggestion for improvement. 
 Prepare reports and analyze Job Costing errors to improve job management performance. 
 Train specialized classes related to C1’s functionalities and other Operation system related modules. 
 Act as the subject matter expert on C1 and Global Compliance Rules to Operation users 
 Provide extensive support through monitoring and resolving C1 eRequests. 
 
 
 
  SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
 
 Perform other tasks as requested to support Global Operation Compliance team’s projects and goals. 
 
 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS:
  
 
 Knowledge in creation of business analytics using Power BI. 
 Knowledge in creation of video training contents. 
 Familiar with in freight forwarding business process (air and sea freight). 
 Motivate to acquire excellent understanding of JAS Global Processes, Global Business Rules and Operational Procedures. 
 Motivate to acquire excellent understanding of C1 functionality and processes. 
 
 
 
  Technical/Software
  
 
 Excellent Microsoft Office skills, especially Power BI, and MS Excel. 
 Experience with video editing tools such as Camtasia & Adobe Captivate is a plus 
 Fluent in the usage of with Microsoft Word, Outlook, PowerPoint. 
 Must be comfortable with tele-communication tools such as MS Teams, Skype, ZOOM. 
 
 
 
  Language
  
 
 Excellent knowledge of oral and written English language. Ability to verbally communicate information in a clear and concise manner. 
 Must have ability to read and interpret documents such as Business Cases, Project Plans, Business Requirements, User Guides, Training Manuals, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. 
 
 
 
  Mathematical Skills
  
 
 Ability to add, subtracts, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar / pie graphs. 
 
 
 
  Other
  
 
 Ability to learn quickly 
 Business Intelligence, Training Contents Development, Business Analyst, Business Process Management background is desirable. 
 Strong Organizational and Self-Motivation skills – Ability to effectively handle multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritize, and execute on assigned deliverables. 
 Able to work with in a matrix reporting environment, build and maintain strong relationships with peers, stakeholders and management who will largely be based remotely. 
 Solution driven with the willingness and ability to implement innovative ideas to improve processes and procedures. 
 Able to commit to and demonstrate the core values: Respect, Courage, Passion, Integrity and Teamwork. 
 
 
 
  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
  
 
  o College degree preferred.
  
 
  o Business Intelligence, Business Analysis experience is of advantage.
  
 
  o LMS/Training Contents Development experience is of advantage.
  
 
  o Freight Forwarding background is of advantage
  
 
 
  ENVIRONMENT:
  
 
  This position is performed in climate-controlled internal office environment working under normal office conditions. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
 
 
  This position will require travel including domestic and international.
  
 
 
  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; stand; walk; use hands and finger to feel and handle; reach with arms and hands; talk and hear.
  
 
 
  While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, and crouch; lift weight or exert a force up to a maximum of 25 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
 
 
  ADDITIONAL:
  
 
  The responsibilities associated with this job will change from time to time in accordance with the Company’s business needs. More specifically, the incumbent may be required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those set forth above.
  
 
 
  The above declarations are not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be such a listing of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job.
  
 
 
  JAS is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We are seeking a European Senior Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong background in advanced analytics and data-driven insight production, leveraging Microsoft technologies to support strategic decision-making.    This role will report directly to the Global Manager of Business Intelligence.    The ideal candidate will have significant experience working with global business teams, particularly in enhancing data-driven decision-making across various functions. This role requires expertise in designing and implementing robust business intelligence solutions within the Microsoft ecosystem, ensuring seamless data integration and efficient processing.    Candidates should have deep proficiency in developing and deploying scalable data models and analytics solutions, including Azure Synapse, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory. Experience managing the full data lifecycle—from ingestion, transformation, and modelling to visualization and presentation of actionable insights to senior leadership—is essential.    Required skills include project management, process optimization, data analytics, reporting, and advanced data management. The candidate should demonstrate proficiency in managing complex data environments and driving improvements that enhance data quality and reliability.    Strong communication skills are crucial for effectively supporting various stakeholders, including executives, managers, and data teams, in understanding and utilizing analytics outputs. The ability to create and socialize dynamic reporting solutions, such as interactive dashboards, performance metrics, and trend analyses, is also necessary.    Experience with migrating existing BI solutions from legacy systems to modern platforms is a plus. The candidate should be comfortable with data migration strategies, automation, and integrating new technologies to streamline business intelligence processes.    Knowledge of the Microsoft data ecosystem and its integration with other enterprise tools, including an understanding of system interactions, is desirable. Familiarity with ERP systems and their integration with BI platforms is also beneficial.
  
 
 
  Key Responsibilities: 
 
 Collaborate with global business leaders to define BI requirements and translate them into effective analytics solutions. 
 Design, develop, and deploy scalable data models and reporting solutions using Microsoft technologies. 
 Manage and optimize data environments to ensure high data quality and accessibility. 
 Lead projects involving data migration from legacy BI systems to modern platforms, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruption. 
 Develop dynamic and interactive dashboards and reports that support data-driven decision-making across the organization. 
 Present findings and insights to senior leadership, providing actionable recommendations based on data analysis. 
 Continuously improve BI processes and tools to enhance efficiency, scalability, and data reliability. 
 Stay updated on the latest BI tools and technologies within the Microsoft ecosystem and provide strategic input on their adoption. 
 
 
 
 
  Required Skills and Experience: 
 
 Extensive experience in business intelligence and data analytics, with a strong focus on Microsoft tools and platforms. 
 
 
 
 A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related discipline, or equivalent experience in the field of business intelligence and analytics. 
 Proven track record of designing and implementing BI solutions using tools such as Power BI, Azure Synapse, and Azure Data Factory. 
 Strong knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes. 
 Excellent project management skills, with experience in leading complex data migration projects. 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. 
 Exceptional written and oral communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels. 
 Experience with automation of reporting and data processes is highly desirable. 
 Familiarity with ERP systems and their integration with BI platforms is a plus. 
 
 
 
  Join our team and leverage your expertise in business intelligence to drive our global data strategy forward!
  
 
 
  For more details please contact Carl Rigby at carl.rigby@wolterskluwer.com

Within Data and Supply Chain 
 
 Innovation starts with being curious 
 At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable, and convenient mobility. Want to join us? 
 
  Global Supply Chain Management  – let’s introduce ourselves 
 At Volvo Cars Global Supply Chain Management, we develop a global inbound supply chain that is constantly evolving to be ready for the future. We do this in a lean and sustainable manner with a constant eye on new opportunities and developments. We care about people, safety, and sustainability in line with our brand promise. 
 
 At Inbound Logistics Engineering, we work together with internal and external stakeholders to find the best-in-class logistics solutions for our global inbound supply chain towards our production plants. We are a diverse global team based in Gothenburg, Shanghai and Charleston and we are now looking for an experienced logistic analyst to complement our team of project managers and engineers in EMEA. The automotive logistics industry is a progressive yet rewarding place to be with lots of challenges in the years ahead as the automotive industry is transforming to an electrified and sustainable future. 
 
 What you’ll do 
 
 This is a Senior Logistics Analyst role, reporting to the Head of Inbound Engineering EMEA. 
 You will work both as an integrated part of cross functional strategic projects as well as on individual assignments ranging from advanced network optimization to individual flow analysis for our inbound network. 
 You are expected to gather, interpret, and use data to perform different types of analysis as well as develop analysis methods and models that supports the business in taking correct decisions. Visualizing analysis results in the way that enables efficient communication will also be a key part of your tasks. 
 Manage all aspects of the supply chain by analyzing data and making recommendations for improving efficiency, reducing costs, and ensuring timely delivery. 
 You are expected to aim to develop Volvo Cars’ supply chain to be as sustainable and cost efficient as possible while delivering the highest quality of service. 
 You will also develop, as well as be part of, cross functional teams with our stakeholders to work towards the common goal of having a lean supply chain from supplier to when the material is used on the production line. 
 
 
 What You’ll Bring 
 
 The ideal candidate has a university degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering or similar and has worked in the field for several years. 
 Having experience from making advanced logistical analysis as well as handling large data sets is key to be effective in this role. 
 Knowledge and experience from working with Power BI, Tableau, ETL-tools, SQL and Supply chain optimization tools is seen as a valuable asset. 
 As a person, you are structured and motivated with strong analytical skills and the ability to achieve results in situations with high degrees of complexity. You thrive in an environment where you are made to develop new analysis methods and to continuously develop your skills. 
 You have effective verbal and written communication skills and are motivated by working in a global organization and in cross functional teams. 
 
 
 Want to know more? We hope so  For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Recruiter Gabriela Moraes at gabriela.moraes@volvocars.com 
   Please note that applications by email will not be accepted. 
 
 Volvo Cars - Driving change together 
 Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable, and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones, and the people around them. 
 
 Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 1+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.  Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.    Rollbeskrivning:  Assignment Description  Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking an IT Business Analyst – Customs for an onsite position at their Gothenburg office. This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated professional to contribute to key business and technology initiatives within a dynamic, global organization.    Qualifications:  Several years of experience in a similar position as an IT Business Analyst, with a proven track record in the industry.  Strong domain knowledge in supply chain and logistics (experience in customs is a plus).  Experience within the automotive industry is beneficial.  Proficiency in data modeling, preferably using Power BI.  Familiarity with analyzing commonly used file formats such as XML, JSON, YAML, etc.  Experience with PDM/BOM structures is an advantage.  Skilled in interviewing key stakeholders and facilitating workshops to identify business needs and model processes/information.  Proven ability to lead investigations and projects from start to finish.    Desired Attributes:  Excellent analytical and documentation skills to effectively capture and communicate insights.  Strong ability to navigate and understand complex digital ecosystems with multiple integrations.  A clear understanding of dependencies and interfaces between processes and solutions.  A good understanding of Agile development methodologies.  Experience in creating features, user stories, and acceptance criteria/scenarios to guide development teams.   Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.  Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.  Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

Ansök nu   
 
 
 
 
 Är du Data  Analyst/BI Utvecklare med inriktning mot Power BI och vill bli en del av vårt lokala team inom Data & AI? Här finns möjligheten till ett långsiktigt arbete  med att trygga uppdrag. 
 Vi söker dig som har flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med BI eller Analytics. På kontoret finns kollegor inom BI området som arbetar med allt från klassisk Business Intelligence till moderna cloud lösningar i Microsoft Azure, men även MDM och AI/ML. 
 Inom Sogeti finns det många hjälpsamma och glada kollegor med stor erfarenhet inom området. Vi prioriterar en balans mellan arbete och fritid högt och har en familjär arbetskultur. Det finns även ett brett nätverk inom hela Sogeti som hjälper dig att bredda och spetsa dina kunskaper. 
 Vem söker vi? 
 Du trivs i rollen som konsult, med möjlighet att växa och få ett omväxlande arbete. Vi tror att du är fokuserad, lösningsorienterad och analytisk. Du kan arbeta självgående och du brinner för ditt område och vill ha möjligheter att vidareutvecklas. 
 Vi tror att du har några av följande: 
 
 Innehar en eller flera certifieringar inom Microsoft Power BI, t.ex PL-300 och/eller DP-600. Det är meriterande om du även har certifieringar eller kompetens inom Azure cloud, t.ex. DP-203. 
 3 års erfarenhet inom Power BI som utvecklare (M Query, DAX) 
 Du talar och skriver flytande svenska och uttrycker dig väl i tal och skrift på engelska. 
 
 Vilka är vi? 
 Vi på Sogeti i region Syd har en härlig gemenskap och tycker det är viktigt att ha kul på jobbet och stötta och lära av varandra. Dina nya kollegor är fantastiska systemutvecklare, systemarkitekter, projektledare, förvaltningsledare, ux-designers, testledare och testare. Bland våra kunder finns regionens myndigheter och större företag men du kan också dra fördel av hela Sogeti som ger möjlighet till spännande uppdrag runt om i Sverige. 
 Läs mer om några av de många anledningarna som finns för att jobba hos oss: 
 
 Våra förmåner - Här hittar du en översikt av de förmåner vi erbjuder på Sogeti. 
 Din utveckling - Vårt mål är att den som är anställd hos oss ska vara på en ständig utvecklingsresa och bli den bästa versionen av sig själv. 
 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 
 
 Vi ser gärna att du har: 
 
 Några års erfarenhet i rollen som Data Engineer eller några års erfarenheter av BI-lösningar som utvecklare eller arkitekt 
 Universitets- eller högskoleexamen (eller motsvarande) 
 Behärskar svenska flytande i tal och skrift 
 
 Alternativt du som är: 
 
 En systemutvecklarninja, gärna med erfarenhet av Cloud, som vill börja jobba med Data Engineering, Analytics eller BI 
 
 Varmt välkommen att bli en del av vårt Data & AI-team! Hoppas vi ses!

Company Description 
  Massive Entertainment is a world-leading AAA studio located in Malmö, Sweden and part of the Ubisoft family. We’re a multinational team of more than 750 passionate and highly skilled people from 50+ different countries. Our studio’s goal has always been – and still is – to craft the finest gaming experiences for all players. 
 At Massive, you get to do what you love most while bringing your own experience to our ongoing projects, like Tom Clancy’s The Division 2, Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, and Star Wars Outlaws. We're also developing new tech here, such as our in-house engine Snowdrop, and Ubisoft Connect - Ubisoft's digital ecosystem and distribution platform.  Job Description 
  We are looking for a Production Analyst Lead to join our Production Analytics team. You will be responsible for the team working on visualizing, monitoring, analyzing, and providing all data related to game production control. This data will be used to provide visibility and predictability of our game productions, allowing producers to make informed decisions, measure progress, mitigate risks, plan ahead, and improve the way we make games. In this role you will work with several different data sources, ranging from HR and financial data to data from our project tracking software, version control software and build pipeline. Reporting to the Game Intelligence Director, you’ll collaborate with different stakeholders (Producers and Directors) across the organization to understand the needs and to communicate findings and recommendations to production. 
 We're offering a permanent position in Malmö, Sweden, with the flexibility to work partially from home (up to two days a week) under our Flexible Workplace Policy. Please apply using English, our company's primary language. 
  What you’ll do 
 
 Utilize data and KPIs to provide insights and guidance to production teams. 
 Work with producers to identify what data and visualizations are needed to improve visibility and predictability. 
 Establish how data and insights will be reported and ensure the accuracy and relevance of the reporting. 
 Monitor production data and providing ongoing risk assessment, flagging any trends or KPIs that are off target. 
 Manage and provide guidence to direct reports. 
 International travel may be necessary. 
    Qualifications 
  What you’ll bring 
 You’re interested in videogames and find joy discussing statistics and data technologies. You have experience with extracting, transforming and loading data from different sources and know how to visualize and communicate insights in an actionable way. For you to excel in this role you need to have a perspective on both business and production analysis, with a good understanding of agile project management principles for large projects. You feel confident in creating precise visualizations and presenting data tailored to your different audiences. You are comfortable and experienced working with senior stakeholders and know how to communicate constructively, as well as explaining and adapting complex information to the audience. It is important that you understand production and the factors that are important for it to run smoothly and efficiently. Besides the above we’re looking for someone aligned with our core values and the following skills: 
 
 Proficient in creating user-friendly data visualizations in big organizations with huge interfaces (using Tableau and Power BI). 
 Knowledge in software production processes and principles. 
 Experience developing a team within data analytics or similar. 
 Advanced knowledge in SQL, Pyspark, Spark and Python languages. 
 Effective communicator with experience managing interactions across many organizational levels. 
 Experience working with Jira. 
 Experience working with Git. 
 Knowledge in game production methodologies is beneficial. 
 Experience in a leadership role or at a point in your career where you are prepared and experienced enough to embrace leadership responsibilities. 
 
  Additional Information 
  Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown. 
 You can also find a summary of the Massive Job Perks here. 
  Questions?  We're more than happy to answer them! Please contact Paula Roese Mesquita, Talent Acquisition Partner for this position.
